sapa: <entryFree id="n42555" type="main" key="sa^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Germ. Saft; Engl sap</etym>, <sense id="n42555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">must</hi> or <hi rend="ital">new wine boiled thick</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 551, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">551, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:121" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 19, 24, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:780" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 780</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:53:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 53, 6</bibl>; Fest. s. v. burranica, p. 30.</sense></entryFree>
sapaei: <entryFree id="n42556" type="main" key="Sa^paei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săpaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sapai=oi,</foreign> <sense id="n42556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thracian people on the Propontis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:389" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 389</bibl>. <pb n="1629" /> <cb n="SAPI" /></sense></entryFree>
sape: <entryFree id="n42557" type="main" key="Sape_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sapē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Ethiopia on the Arabian gulf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sapenos: <entryFree id="n42558" type="foreign" key="sapenos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sapenos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Indian</etym>, <sense id="n42558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bright hyacinth-colored amethyst found in India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 122</bibl>; v. sacondios.</sense></entryFree>
saperda: <entryFree id="n42559" type="main" key="sa_perda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sāperda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sape/rdhs,</foreign> <sense id="n42559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inferior kind of salt fish from the Black Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a herring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sardine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:134" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 134</bibl>; cf.: saperda genus pessimi piscis, Fest. pp. 324 and 325 Müll.—Hence, transf.: omnes videmur nobis esse belli, festivi, saperdae cum simus <foreign lang="greek">saproi/,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">rotten sardines</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 176, 20 sq.</bibl> (Sat. Men. 56, 2); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saperdae quasi sapientes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1</bibl></cit>. 1., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=325" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 325</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
saphon: <entryFree id="n42560" type="main" key="sapho_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saphōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ship's cable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sapide: <entryFree id="n42561" type="main" key="sa^pi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sapidus <sense id="n42561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sapidus: <entryFree id="n42562" type="main" key="sa^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sapio</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n42562.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">well-tasted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tucetum perquam sapidissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10</bibl>, p. 344, 32: <cit><quote lang="la">avis sapidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:6" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42562.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">să-pĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">savorily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur sapidissime percoctum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sapiens: <entryFree id="n42563" type="main" key="sa^pi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from sapio.</entryFree>
sapienter: <entryFree id="n42564" type="main" key="sa^pi^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sapio, <sense id="n42564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sapientia: <entryFree id="n42565" type="main" key="sa^pi^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sapiens</etym>. <sense id="n42565.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to sapiens, A.) Prop., <hi rend="ital">good taste</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">good sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discernment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discretion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intelligence</hi> (class.; syn. prudentia): pellitur e medio sapientia, vi geritur res, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 272 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">non aetate verum ingenio adipiscitur sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac participes nos tuae sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque habet (erus meus) plus sapientiae quam lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 53</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulo Moneo, quae possum, pro meā sapientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta mea sapientia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erum anteëo sapientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">re enim iniquum est, sed tuā sapientiā fit aequissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam enim temeritas cum sapientiā commiscetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid virtus et quid sapientia possit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia prima (est), stultitiā caruisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 396</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insaniens sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 34, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42565.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to sapiens, B.) <hi rend="ital">Wisdom</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">sofi/a</foreign> (so predominantly in the class. per., e. g. in Cic.): nec quisquam sophiam, sapientia quae perhibetur, In somnis vidit, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=325" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 325</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 227 Vahl.); cf.: Sophiam vocant me Graii, vos Sapientiam, Afran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8, 3</bibl>; and: princeps omnium virtutum illa sapientia, quam <foreign lang="greek">sofi/an</foreign> Graeci vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sapientiam hujus nimius nugator fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fit, ut mater omnium bonarum rerum sit sapientia, a cujus amore Graeco verbo philosophia nomen invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia hominis custos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem spem salutis ad clementiam victoris et sapientiam contulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum vobis pro vestrā sapientiā, Quirites, habenda est ratio diligenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae vocem audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctores sapientiae,</quote> <trans><tr>philosophers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 16</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">admirari soleo cum ceterarum rerum tuam excellentem, M. Cato, perfectamque sapientiam tum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in other things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, sarcastically: qui (sapientes) si virtutes ebullire volent et sapientias, nihil aliud dicent, nisi, etc. (the <number>plur.</number> denoting their perpetual speaking of wisdom), a saying referred to Epicurus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 18, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42565.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of single departments of knowledge, science, or wisdom, <hi rend="ital">practical wisdom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knowledge of the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">philosophy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia est, ut a veteribus philosophis definitum est, rerum divinarum et humanarum causarumque, quibus eae res continentur, scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia, quae ars vivendi putanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 42</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">ars est philosophia vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>).—Of jurisprudence: <cit><quote lang="la">istam oscitantem sapientiam Scaevolarum et ceterorum beatorum otio concedamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">his temporibus audaciā pro sapientiā liceat uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> —Of eloquence: hanc cogitandi pronunciandique<cb n="SAPI" />  rationem vimque dicendi veteres Graeci sapientiam nominabant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 56</bibl>.—Of statesmanship, policy: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia constituendae civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 154</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui propter ancipitem, quae non potest esse sejuncta, faciendi dicendique sapientiam florerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16, 59</bibl></cit>. —Of mathematics: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae professor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sapientialis: <entryFree id="n42566" type="hapax" key="sa^pi^enti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpĭentĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sapientia</etym>, <sense id="n42566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to wisdom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summus in animā gradus vitalis et sapientialis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sapientipotens: <entryFree id="n42567" type="hapax" key="sa^pi^enti^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpĭentĭ-pŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sapiens</etym>, <sense id="n42567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mighty in wisdom</hi>: bellipotentes sunt magis quam sapientipotentes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 116</bibl> (Ann. v. 188 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
sapineus: <entryFree id="n42568" type="main" key="sapi_ne^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sapīnĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sapp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sapinus</etym>, <sense id="n42568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> sapinus: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n42569" type="main" key="Sa_pi^ne^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāpĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sapis.</entryFree>
sapinus: <entryFree id="n42570" type="main" key="sapi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sapīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sapp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n42570.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of fir-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pine-tree</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 75, § 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 61</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 36</bibl> (al. sappium).— </sense><sense id="n42570.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the lower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smooth part of the fir-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 76, § 196</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sapio: <entryFree id="n42571" type="main" key="sa^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi</itype> (sapui, Aug. Civ. Dei, 1, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:102:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 102, 10</bibl>; but sapivi, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 879</bibl> P.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 508, 21</bibl>: <sense id="n42571.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">saPisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:6:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">o)po/s, safh/s,</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">sofo/s</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">to taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savor; to taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smack</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">savor of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have a taste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flavor of</hi> a thing (cf. gusto). </sense><sense id="n42571.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (so only in a few examples). </sense><sense id="n42571.2" n="1" level="3"> Of things eaten or drunk: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum male sapiet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 66, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occisam saepe sapere plus multo suem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin caseus jucundissime sapiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil rhombus nil dama sapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 121</bibl></cit>.—With an <case>acc.</case> of that of or like which a thing tastes: <cit><quote lang="la">quis (piscis) saperet ipsum mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in Hispaniā multa mella herbam eam sapiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 8, 8, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum aprum (ursina),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 66, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: anas plebeium sapit, <hi rend="ital">has a vulgar taste</hi>, Petr. poët. 93, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesivit quidnam saperet simius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42571.3" n="2" level="3"> Of that which tastes, <hi rend="ital">to have a taste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a sense of taste</hi> (perh. so used for the sake of the play upon signif. II.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec sequitur, ut, cui cor sapiat, ei non sapiat palatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42571.4" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of smell, <hi rend="ital">to smell of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">like</hi> a thing (syn.: oleo, redoleo; very rare): Cicero, Meliora, inquit, unguenta sunt, quae terram quam crocum sapiunt. Hoc enim maluit dixisse quam redolent. Ita est profecto; <cit><quote lang="la">illa erit optima, quae unguenta sapiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenitur unguenta gratiosiora esse, quae terram, quam quae crocum sapiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 3, 4, § 21</bibl></cit>.—In a lusus verbb. with signif. II.: istic servus quid sapit? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Hircum ab alis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 47</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42571.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42571.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To taste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">smell of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savor of</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n42571.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To resemble</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">patruos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42571.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To suggest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be inspired by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia non sapis ea quae Dei sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 16, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 8, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42571.9" n="c" level="4"> Altum or alta sapere, <hi rend="ital">to be high-minded</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli altum sapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:11:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 11, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non alta sapientes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42571.10" n="2" level="3"> To have good taste, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to have sense</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discernment; to be sensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discreet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wise</hi>, etc. (the predominant signif. in prose and poetry; most freq. in the <pos>P. a.</pos>). </sense><sense id="n42571.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aequum siet Me plus sapere quam vos, dederim vobis consilium catum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:73 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 73 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam diu edepol sapientiam tuam abusa est haec quidem. Nunc hinc sapit, hinc sentit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populus est moderatior, quoad sentit et sapit tuerique vult per se constitutam rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 42, 65</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (with sentire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 292</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:10 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 10 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sapere et fari possit quae sentiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna est admiratio copiose sapienterque dicentis, quem qui audiunt intellegere etiam et sapere plus quam ceteros arbitrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veluti mater Plus quam se sapere Vult (filium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (puer) cum primum sapere coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo, si sapis, cavebis,</quote> <trans><tr>if you are prudent</tr>, <tr>wise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">si sapis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2</bibl>, <cb n="SAPI" /> 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 28</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 138</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sapias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 174</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sapies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 675</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sapiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sapiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si saperet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: hi sapient, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Ibo. <hi rend="ital">Pl.</hi> Sapis, <hi rend="ital">you show your good sense</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic homo sapienter sapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (meretrix) sapit in vino ad rem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnia alia aetate sapimus rectius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud stulte sapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te aliis consilium dare, Foris sapere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus quoi sapit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 53</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui cor sapiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id (sc. animus mensque) sibi solum per se sapit, id sibi gaudet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42571.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to know</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understand</hi> a thing (in good prose usually only with general objects): <cit><quote lang="la">recte ego rem meam sapio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: qui sibi semitam non sapiunt, alteri monstrant viam, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 65</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam quis, qui aliquid sapiat, nunc esse beatus potest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ego sapio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam nihil sapit nec sentit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plane nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 55</bibl></cit>: nihil parvum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to occupy one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s mind with nothing trivial</hi> (with sublimia cures), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 15</bibl>; cf.: cum sapimus patruos, i.e. <hi rend="ital">resemble them</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitate them</hi> in severity, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 11</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42571.13" n="3" level="3"> Prov.: sero sapiunt Phryges, <hi rend="ital">are wise behind the time;</hi> or, as the Engl. saying is, <hi rend="ital">are troubled with afterwit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sero sapiunt Phryges proverbium est natum a Trojanis, qui decimo denique anno velle coeperant Helenam quaeque cum eā erant rapta reddere Achivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=343" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 343</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Equo Trojano (a tragedy of Livius Andronicus or of Naevius) scis esse in extremo, Sero sapiunt. Tu tamen, mi vetule, non sero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">să-pĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> (<hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> sapiente, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 622</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> sapientum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 296</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but sapientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 21, 14</bibl></cit>), <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">wise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-advised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discreet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judicious</hi> (cf. prudens). </sense><sense id="n42571.14" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque maxime perspicit, quid in re quāque verissimum sit, quique acutissime et celerrime potest et videre et explicare rationem, is prudentissimus et sapientissimus rite haberi solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientissimum esse dicunt eum, cui quod opus sit ipsi veniat in mentem: proxume acceder illum, qui alterius bene inventis obtemperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Bucculeius, homo neque meo judicio stultus et suo valde sapiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex aequus ac sapiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyrus justissimus sapientissimusque rex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus et sapiens et peritus utilitatis civilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o, Neptune lepide, salve, Neque te aleator ullus est sapientior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tibi mulier videtur multo sapientissima?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Aurora) ibat ad hunc (Cephalum) sapiens a sene diva viro,</quote> <trans><tr>wise</tr>, <tr>discreet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 96</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mus pusillus quam sit sapiens bestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 114</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (analogous to gnarus, peritus, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui sapiens rerum esse humanarum velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">săpĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discreet</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">judicious person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper cavere hoc sapientes aequissimumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sapientes suom officium aequom est colere et facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum sapienti sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:15 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 15 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insani sapiens nomen ferat, aequus iniqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens causas reddet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quali victu sapiens utetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>; 1, 3, 132.—In a lusus verbb. with the signif. of sapio, I., <hi rend="ital">a person of nice taste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui utuntur vino vetere sapientes puto Et qui libenter veteres spectant fabulas,</quote> <trans><tr>good judges</tr>, <tr>connoisseurs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 5</bibl></cit>: fecundae <pb n="1630" /> <cb n="SAPO" /> leporis sapiens sectabitur armos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 44</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">a surname</hi> of the jurists Atilius, C. Fabricius, M'. Curius, Ti. Coruncanius, Cato al., v. under B. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n42571.15" n="b" level="4"> Of abstract things: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excusatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modica et sapiens temperatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ulixes, vir sapienti facundiā praeditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morus, quae novissima urbanarum germinat, nec nisi exacto frigore, ob id dicta sapientissima arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 25, 41, § 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42571.16" n="B" level="2"> After the predominance of Grecian civilization and literature, particularly of the Grecian philosophy, like <foreign lang="greek">sofo/s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">well acquainted with the true value of things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wise;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wise man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sage</hi> (in Cic. saepiss.): ergo hic, quisquis est, qui moderatione et constantiā quietus animo est sibique ipse placatus ut nec tabescat molestiis nec frangatur timore nec sitienter quid expetens ardeat desiderio nec alacritate futili gestiens deliquescat; <cit><quote lang="la">is est sapiens quem quaerimus, is est beatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientium praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quod raro fit, id portentum putandum est: sapientem esse portentum est. Saepius enim mulam peperisse arbitror, quam sapientem fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 28, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuere quid sit sapiens, vel maxime videtur esse sapientis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:29:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 29, 45</bibl>.—So esp. of the seven <hi rend="ital">wise men</hi> of Greece: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad Graecos referam orationem ... septem fuisse dicuntur uno tempore, qui sapientes et haberentur et vocarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos vero septem quos Graeci sapientes nominaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapienti assentiri ... se sapientem profiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2,3, 7</bibl></cit>.—Ironically: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientum octavus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 296</bibl></cit>.—With the Romans, <hi rend="ital">an appellation of Lœlius</hi>: te, Laeli, sapientem et appellant et existimant. Tribuebatur hoc modo M. Catoni: scimus L. Atilium apud patres nostros appellatum esse sapientem, sed uterque alio quodam modo: Atilius, qui prudens esse in jure civili putabatur; <cit><quote lang="la">Cato quia multarum rerum usum habebat ... propterea quasi cognomen jam habebat in senectute sapientis ... Athenis unum accepimus et eum quidem etiam Apollinis oraculo sapientissimum judicatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam ego dicam C. Fabricium, M'. Curium, Ti. Coruncanium, quos sapientes nostri majores judicabant, ad istorum normam fuisse sapientes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii, qui sapientes sunt habiti, M. Cato et C. Laelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1</bibl>, ext. 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">săpĭen-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sensibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discreetly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judiciously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wisely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte et sapienter facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insipienter factum sapienter ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam sapienter jam reges hoc nostri viderint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 17, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provisa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a majoribus prodita fama,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">considerate etiam sapienterque fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vives sapienter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 48</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facis sapientius Quam pars latronum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo est, qui tibi sapientius suadere possit te ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientius fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 42, 155</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod majores nostros et probavisse maxime et retinuisse sapientissime judico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sapis: <entryFree id="n42572" type="main" key="Sa_pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāpis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Cisalpine Gaul and Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Ravenna and Ariminum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Savio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:450" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 450</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 406</bibl> (al. Isapis).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāpĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Sapis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sapinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 37, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sapo: <entryFree id="n42573" type="foreign" key="sa_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sāpo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Germ.</etym>, <sense id="n42573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soap</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 12, 51, § 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:26" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 26</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 11, 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saponatum: <entryFree id="n42574" type="main" key="sa_po_na_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sāpōnātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sapo</etym>, <sense id="n42574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soap-water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suds</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sapor: <entryFree id="n42575" type="main" key="sa^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sapio, I.</etym>. <sense id="n42575.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flavor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savor</hi> (objectively of the taste inherent in a thing; whereas gustatus is used subjectively, of the taste experienced by him who eats or drinks; <cit><quote lang="la">class.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 679</bibl></cit>; cf.: si quem forte inveneritis, qui aspernetur oculis pulchritudinem rerum, non odore ullo, non tactu, non sapore <cb n="SAPS" /> capiatur, excludat auribus omnem suavitatem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 17, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mel, suo proprio genere saporis, dulce esse sentitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in os salsi venit umor saepe saporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 222</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:401" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 401</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asper in ore sapor (amelli),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asper maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 100, 104, § 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 9, 38, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odoratus et jucundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 50, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">austerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 5, 20, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristi poma sapore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:12" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 430</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:504" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 504</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:209" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 51, 77, § 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:106 al" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 27, 32, § 106 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42575.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n42575.2" n="1" level="3"> Subjectively for gustatus, <hi rend="ital">a sense of taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a taste</hi> which a person has of any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">an poterunt oculos aures reprehendere? an aures Tactus? an hunc porro tactum sapor arguet oris? ... Seorsus sapor oris habet vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:487 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 487 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis aliud taetrius esset orisque sapori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 511</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42575.3" n="2" level="3"> Concr. (mostly in the <number>plur.</number>), <hi rend="ital">that which tastes good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dainty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicacy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 29, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 1, 2, § 4</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tunsum gallae admiscere saporem,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>juice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 267</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42575.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">odor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 39, § 117</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42575.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42575.6" n="1" level="3"> Of style: <cit><quote lang="la">vernaculus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>taste</tr>, <tr>elegance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:46:172" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46, 172</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo non publici saporis,</quote> <trans><tr>of uncommon elegance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42575.7" n="2" level="3"> Of conduct: <cit><quote lang="la">homo sine sapore,</quote> <trans><tr>without refinement</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> post Red. in Sen. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saporatus: <entryFree id="n42576" type="main" key="sa^po_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sapor</etym>, <sense id="n42576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seasoned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savory</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">offa medicatis frugibus, Petr. poët. Fragm. 19 (dub.): pulmenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 3</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 164</bibl></cit> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
saporosus: <entryFree id="n42577" type="main" key="sa^po_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpōrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of good flavor</hi> (late Lat.), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Fragm. Erem. Serm. 69" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Fragm. Erem. Serm. 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saporus: <entryFree id="n42578" type="main" key="sa^po_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săpōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n42578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that relishes well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savory</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 16, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ham. 751</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sapphar: <entryFree id="n42579" type="main" key="Sapphar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sapphar</orth> (perh. <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>), <sense id="n42579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Arabia Felix</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:23:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26</bibl> § 104.</sense></entryFree>
sapphicus: <entryFree id="n42580" type="main" key="Sapphi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sapphĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sappho.</entryFree>
sapphiratus: <entryFree id="n42581" type="hapax" key="sapphi_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sapphīrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sapphirus</etym>, <sense id="n42581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set with sapphires</hi>: lapillos, Sid. poët. Ep. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">in carm.</hi> v. 14.</sense></entryFree>
sapphirinus: <entryFree id="n42582" type="greek" key="sapphi_ri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sapphīrĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sapfei/rinos,</foreign> <sense id="n42582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of sapphire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sapphirine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a sapphire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 38, § 119</bibl></cit> (Jahn, sappir); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 24, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sapphirus: <entryFree id="n42583" type="greek" key="sapphi_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sapphīrus, sapphir</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sappir</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (i short, Ven. Carm. 6, 2), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/pfeiros,</foreign> <sense id="n42583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sapphire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 39, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 21, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:54:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 54, 11</bibl>.—Form sappir, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 38, § 119</bibl>.—Form sapphir, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 28, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 15, 54, v. 11</bibl> (as <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 9, 2</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
sappho: <entryFree id="n42584" type="main" key="Sappho_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sapphō</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sapfw/,</foreign> <sense id="n42584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated poetess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born at Mytilene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the island of Lesbos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of her hopeless love for Phaon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threw herself from the Leucadian rock into the sea.</hi> Under her name Ovid composed the fifteenth epistle of his Heroides, Sappho Phaoni; <case>nom.</case> Sapphō, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:155" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 125</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Sapphūs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 3</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Sapphō, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 25</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> Sappho, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 8, 9, § 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sap-phĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sappho</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sapphic</hi>: Musa, i.e. <hi rend="ital">Sappho</hi> (as a tenth Muse), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:35:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 35, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <trans><tr>in Sapphic measure</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ephem. 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hendecasyllabum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 508</bibl></cit> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">and metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 1819 sq.</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
sappinus: <entryFree id="n42585" type="main" key="Sappi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sappīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Sapinus.</entryFree>
sappiratus: <entryFree id="n42586" type="main" key="sappi_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sappīrātus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sappīrus</orth>, v. sapphiratus, etc.</entryFree>
sappium: <entryFree id="n42587" type="main" key="sappi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sappĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. sapinus.</entryFree>
sapriportus: <entryFree id="n42588" type="main" key="Sapriportus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sapriportus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harbor between Sybaris and Tarentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saprophago: <entryFree id="n42589" type="greek" key="sapro^pha^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saprŏphăgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">saprofagei=n,</foreign> <sense id="n42589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to eat putrid meat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:77:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 77, 3</bibl> (sometimes written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
sapros: <entryFree id="n42590" type="greek" key="sapros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sapros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sapro/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rotten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 34, § 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sapsa: <entryFree id="n42591" type="main" key="sapsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sapsa</orth>, <sense id="n42591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> [contr. from sa-, i. e. suaipsa; cf.: sam, sas; v. suus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>], <hi rend="ital">his</hi> (<hi rend="ital">her</hi>, <hi rend="ital">its</hi>) <hi rend="ital">own</hi> (ante-class. only in the two foll. passages): quo res sapsa loco sese ostentatque jubetque, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. sas, p. 325 <cb n="SARC" /> Müll.; so, sapsa res, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:page=325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> p. 325</bibl> ib. (Trag. Rel. p. 99 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
sara: <entryFree id="n42592" type="main" key="Sara"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sara</orth>, v. Sarra <sense id="n42592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
saraballa: <entryFree id="n42593" type="main" key="sa^ra^balla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sărăballa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. sarabara.</entryFree>
sarabara: <entryFree id="n42594" type="foreign" key="sa^ra^ba_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sărăbāra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sără-balla</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 1, 9</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, or <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Persian</etym>; cf. Gesen. under <foreign />], <sense id="n42594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wide trowsers</hi>, such as are worn in the East, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Dan. 3, 21</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 23, 2</bibl>.—Form sarabala, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 3, 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saraceni: <entryFree id="n42595" type="main" key="Sarace_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saracēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Saracens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people of Arabia Felix</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 42, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">60, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarcasmos: <entryFree id="n42596" type="greek" key="sarcasmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcasmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sarkasmo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a keen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bitter jest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a taunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gibe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sarcasm</hi>, a figure of speech, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 247</bibl> P. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 57</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 458</bibl> P., written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
sarcimen: <entryFree id="n42597" type="main" key="sarci_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sarcio</etym>, <sense id="n42597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suture</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 149, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarcina: <entryFree id="n42598" type="main" key="sarci^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n42598.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a package</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bundle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pack;</hi> more freq. in the <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">luggage</hi> (class. only in the <number>plur.</number>; not in Cic.); <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego nunc agam? nisi uti sarcinam constringam et clipeum ad dorsum accommodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 195</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcinam inponam seni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">essem militiae sarcina fida tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 46: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117, 11</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcinas colligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 2, 5</bibl>.—Esp. of the baggage of soldiers on the march, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 69" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub sarcinis aggredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. G. 8, 27</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the fruit of the womb: <cit><quote lang="la">Ismenos, qui matri sarcina quondam Prima suae fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcinam effundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 15, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42598.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (Ovid.), <hi rend="ital">a burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weight</hi> of cares, troubles, griefs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 7, 14</bibl>. —Of government, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:101" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcina sum (tibi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sarcinalis: <entryFree id="n42599" type="main" key="sarci^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sarcina</etym> (postclass. for sarcinarius), <sense id="n42599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to burdens</hi> or <hi rend="ital">baggage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pack-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baggage-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">29, 5, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarcinarius: <entryFree id="n42600" type="main" key="sarci^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to burdens</hi> or <hi rend="ital">baggage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pack-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baggage-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sarcinator: <entryFree id="n42601" type="main" key="sarci^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sarcio</etym>, <sense id="n42601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a patcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">botcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mender</hi> of old garments (anteand post-class.), Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 175, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:82" default="NO">47, 2, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:1" default="NO">14, 4, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarcinatrix: <entryFree id="n42602" type="main" key="sarci^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcĭnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sarcinator</etym>, <sense id="n42602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that mends</hi> or <hi rend="ital">patches</hi> (ante- and postclass.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 56, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 645</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarcinatus: <entryFree id="n42603" type="main" key="sarci^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sarcina</etym>, <sense id="n42603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burdened</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nol. Carm. 21, 911</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarcinosus: <entryFree id="n42604" type="hapax" key="sarci^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heavily burdened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavy laden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupi vastis corporibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sarcinula: <entryFree id="n42605" type="main" key="sarci^nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcĭnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bundle</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fardel</hi> (mostly post-Aug. and in <number>plur.</number>); <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcinulas expedire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 28, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colligere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 81, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alligare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:146" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 19, 17 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the wealth she brings her husband</tr>, <tr>her marriage-portion</tr>, <tr>dowry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 160</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sarcio: <entryFree id="n42606" type="main" key="sarci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcĭo</orth>, <itype>sarsi, sartum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">r(a/ptw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n42606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to patch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">botch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restore</hi>, etc.: sarcire est integrum facere, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. sarte, p. 323 Müll. (class.; cf.: renovo, instauro, redintegro). </sense><sense id="n42606.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes veteres, centones, cuculiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in vestimento sartum quod comprehensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 64</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">corbulas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 23, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">31, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 39, 1</bibl></cit> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 64, § 236</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupta intestina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 14, 58, § 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perniones rimasque pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 16, 62, § 221</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis (apum) lapsi ruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 249</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sartum vulnus,</quote> <trans><tr>healed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 206" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 206</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42606.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make amends for; to correct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrimentum in bello acceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 1</bibl></cit>; so, acceptum detrimentum, id. B. C. <pb n="1631" /> <cb n="SARD" /> 1, 45; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 67: acceptum incommodum virtute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcito in XII. Servius Sulpicius ait significare damnum solvito, praestato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=322" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 322</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum studium infamiae sarciendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usuram longi temporis,</quote> <trans><tr>to restore</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an male sarta Gratia nequicquam coit et rescinditur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sartus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">mended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repaired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put in order</hi>, only in the phrase sartus <itype>tectus</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>; or more freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> sarta tecta, <hi rend="ital">buildings in good repair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarte ponebant pro integre. Ob quam causam opera publica, quae locantur, ut integra praestentur, sarta tecta vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=322" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 322</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr.
