Orell.</author> 2488</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum consules aedes sacras locavissent neque potuissent omnia sarta tecta exigere...factum est senatus consultum: quibus de sartis tectis cognitum non esset... Quaesivit quis aedem Castoris sartam tectam deberet tradere... Monumentum quamvis sartum tectum integrumque esset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:50:section=130 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 50, § 130 sq.</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sarta tecta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>, § 103; 2, 1, 49, § 128 Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 2, 1, 50, § 130; 2, 1, 51, § 136; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:7" default="NO">7, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:8:18" default="NO">7, 8, 18</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sarta tecta aedium sacrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 24, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42606.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarta tecta tua praecepta usque habui mea modestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mihi da, ut M'. Curium sartum et tectum, ut aiunt, ab omnique incommodo sincerum integrumque conserves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 50, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sartē</orth> pro integre... Porphyrio ex Verrio et Festo in Auguralibus, inquit, libris ita est: <cit><quote lang="la">sane sarteque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">196</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> P.; cf. supra the pass. from Fest.<</sense></entryFree>
sarcion: <entryFree id="n42607" type="greek" key="sarci^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sarki/on</foreign>, <sense id="n42607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fault</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defect in emeralds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarcites: <entryFree id="n42608" type="greek" key="sarci_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcītes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sarki/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n42608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarcocolla: <entryFree id="n42609" type="greek" key="sarco^colla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcŏcolla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sarkoko/lla</foreign>, <sense id="n42609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Persian gum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 20, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:128" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 14, 78, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarcophagus: <entryFree id="n42610" type="greek" key="sarco^pha^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcŏphăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sarkofa(/gos</foreign> (flesh-devouring, carnivorous): sarcophagus lapis, <sense id="n42610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of limestone used for coffins</hi> (so called because the corpses were quickly consumed by it), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 96, 98, § 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:161" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 17, 27, § 161</bibl>.—In medicine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 140</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42610.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcŏphăgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcŏphă-gum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> 7, 8</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a grave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sepulchre</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:172" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:18" default="NO">34, 1, 18</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 203</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 194</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4432</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4554 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sarcosis: <entryFree id="n42611" type="greek" key="sarco_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/rkwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n42611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swelling in the flesh</hi> of animals, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 25, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarculatio: <entryFree id="n42612" type="main" key="sarcu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sarculo</etym>, <sense id="n42612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hoeing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 21, 50, § 184</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarculo: <entryFree id="n42613" type="main" key="sarcu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sarculum</etym>, <sense id="n42613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hoe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta, segetes, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oct. 11, 2</bibl>: nata in hortis sarculatis, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 264.</sense></entryFree>
sarculum: <entryFree id="n42614" type="main" key="sarcu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n42614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form, <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi>, sarculos, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43, 3</bibl>) [sario = sarrio], an implement for loosening the soil, weeding, etc., <hi rend="ital">a light hoe</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ligo, pastinum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">155, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=134" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 134</bibl> Muüll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 18, § 79</bibl> (Jahn, sacculo); 19, 6, 33, § 109; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:699" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 699</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 7, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarculus: <entryFree id="n42615" type="main" key="sarcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sarculum <sense id="n42615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sarda: <entryFree id="n42616" type="main" key="sarda1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n42616.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of fish</hi> that was pickled or salted, perh. <hi rend="ital">sardine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:46" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 5, 17, § 46</bibl>.—Also called sardina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42616.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of precious stone</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">carnelian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 31, § 105</bibl>.<</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42617" type="main" key="Sarda2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Sardinian woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 4, 5</bibl>.—In a lusus verbb. with 1. sarda: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis salsa ista Sarda fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sardachates: <entryFree id="n42618" type="greek" key="sarda^cha_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sardăchātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sardaxa/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n42618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sardachate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carnelian-agate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 139</bibl> (Jahn, zmaragdachates).</sense></entryFree>
sardanapalus: <entryFree id="n42619" type="main" key="Sarda^na^pa_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardănăpālus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-pallus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sardana/palos</foreign>, <sense id="n42619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated effeminate king of Assyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who at last burned himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">together with his treasures</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:362" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 362</bibl>; <cb n="SARI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:313" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 313</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7</bibl> pr.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, as a designation for <hi rend="ital">a weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:11:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 11, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardănăpā-lĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Sardanapalus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sardanapalicum in morem prandere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sardare: <entryFree id="n42620" type="gloss" key="sarda_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sardāre</orth>, v. sardo.</entryFree>
sardes: <entryFree id="n42621" type="main" key="Sardes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardes</orth>, v. Sardis.</entryFree>
sardi: <entryFree id="n42622" type="main" key="Sardi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from <foreign lang="greek">*sardw/</foreign>, Sardinia</etym>, <sense id="n42622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the island of Sardinia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Sardinians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:19:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 19, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 18, 41</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">noted for their faithlessness,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:19:42 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 19, 42 sq.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, prov.: Sardi venales, alius alio nequior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=322" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 322</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Men. 78" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Men. 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 57:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 57, 2</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n42622.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Sardinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tigellius,</quote> <trans><tr>of Sardinia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 375</bibl></cit> (Sardum mel pessimi saporis, Schol.): <cit><quote lang="la">triticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 196</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42622.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sar-dōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sardw=|os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Sardinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:289" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Sardinia</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>a poisonous plant</tr>, <tr>crowfoot</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 4, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 23, 431</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42622.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Sardinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sardonia herba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:343" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 343</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42622.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardĭnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*sardo/nios</foreign>, Sardinian), <hi rend="ital">the island of Sardinia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:22:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Scaur. 22, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:32 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 32 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:60:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 60, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42622.5" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardĭnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Sardinian</hi>: tapetes, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 542, 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42622.6" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardĭnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Sardinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <trans><tr>upon the subjection of Sardinia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sever. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sardiani: <entryFree id="n42623" type="main" key="Sardi^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Sardis <sense id="n42623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sardina: <entryFree id="n42624" type="main" key="sardina"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sardina</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. sarda, I.</entryFree>
sardinia: <entryFree id="n42625" type="main" key="Sardi^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardĭnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Sardi, C.</entryFree>
sardinianus: <entryFree id="n42626" type="main" key="Sardi^ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardĭnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sardi, D.</entryFree>
sardiniensis: <entryFree id="n42627" type="main" key="Sardi^ni^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardĭnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Sardi, E.</entryFree>
sardinus: <entryFree id="n42628" type="main" key="sardi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sardīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sardius <sense id="n42628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sardis: <entryFree id="n42629" type="main" key="Sardi_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardīs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sardes</orth>), <itype>ĭum</itype> (cf.: <sense id="n42629.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">hae Sardis, has Sardis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 775</bibl></cit> P.; Freund, Annott. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:page=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. p. 14</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sa/rdeis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Sardis</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Sart</hi>), <hi rend="ital">the very ancient capital of Lydia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Pactolus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the residence of Crœsus; nom.</hi> Sardis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 215</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> Sardium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:45" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 45</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Sardis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:17:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 17, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:31:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 31, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> and <case>abl.</case> Sardibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 19, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 30, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4</bibl>, ext. 6.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sardis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sardian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">balani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisdictio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 29, 30, § 111</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardĭ-āni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sardis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Sardians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 55, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sardius: <entryFree id="n42630" type="main" key="sardi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sardĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. 1. sarda, II.</etym>, <sense id="n42630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sardian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carnelian</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 28, 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sardĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the carnelian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 39, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:21:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 21, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called lapis sardinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 15, 54, v. 11 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sardo: <entryFree id="n42631" type="hapax" key="sardo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sardo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n42631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to understand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sardare intellegere. Naevius. Quod bruti nec satis sardare queunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=322" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 322</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
sardonia: <entryFree id="n42632" type="main" key="Sardo^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardŏnĭa herba</orth>, v. Sardi, B. <sense id="n42632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sardonychatus: <entryFree id="n42633" type="main" key="sardo^ny^cha_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sardŏnychātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sardonyx</etym>, <sense id="n42633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned with a sardonyx</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:29:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 29, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sardonyx: <entryFree id="n42634" type="greek" key="sardo^nyx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sardŏnyx</orth>, <itype>ychis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sardo/nuc</foreign>, <sense id="n42634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sardonyx; fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 23, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:16" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:144" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 144</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:382" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 382</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:28:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 28, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:61:6" default="NO">4, 61, 6</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi> sardonychum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:139" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 139</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sardŏnĭchus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of sardonyx</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 28, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sardous: <entryFree id="n42635" type="main" key="Sardo_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sardi, B.</entryFree>
sardus: <entryFree id="n42636" type="main" key="Sardus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sardus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sardi, A.</entryFree>
sare: <entryFree id="n42637" type="main" key="Sare_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 41, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sargus: <entryFree id="n42638" type="greek" key="sargus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sargus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/rgos</foreign>, <sense id="n42638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sea-fish</hi> esteemed by the Romans, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:162" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 51, 74, § 162</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=322" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 322</bibl> Müll.; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:105" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sari: <entryFree id="n42639" type="greek" key="sari"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sari</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/ri</foreign>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">saripha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shrub growing on the banks of the Nile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 23, 45, § 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sario: <entryFree id="n42640" type="main" key="sari^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. sarrio <sense id="n42640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi> <cb n="SARP" /></sense></entryFree>
sarisa: <entryFree id="n42641" type="greek" key="sari_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarīsa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-issa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/risa</foreign>. <sense id="n42641.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A long Macedonian lance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:42" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:36" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:19" default="NO">9, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 466</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 479 al.</bibl>; cf. Fest. pp. 145 and 251.—</sense><sense id="n42641.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., for <hi rend="ital">Macedonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 298</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 47</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">denominatio est ...si quis Macedonas appellarit hoc modo: Non tam cito sarissae Graecia potiti sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sarisophoros: <entryFree id="n42642" type="greek" key="sari_so^pho^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarīsŏphŏros</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sarissŏ-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sarisofo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n42642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Macedonian lancer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saritorius: <entryFree id="n42643" type="main" key="sari_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarītōrĭus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sarītūra</orth>, etc., v. sarrit-.</entryFree>
sarmadacus: <entryFree id="n42644" type="main" key="sarmada^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarmadăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. samardacus.</entryFree>
sarmata: <entryFree id="n42645" type="main" key="Sarma^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarmăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sarma/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n42645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Sarmatian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 430</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 111</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarmătae</orth> (Gr. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Saurŏ-mătae</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:198" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 198</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 10, 5</bibl>; 4, 1, 94; 5, 1, 74; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:235" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:2" default="NO">2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 38</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 80</bibl>; v. also in the foll.), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sauroma/tai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Sarmatians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a great Slavic people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwelling from the Vistula to the Don</hi>, in the mod. Poland and Russia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:8" default="NO">3, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 801</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:100" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 10, 24, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">43</bibl>; 46; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 79</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, mostly collect.; Gr. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Saurŏmătes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 30</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Saurŏmăta</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 63</bibl> (13). </sense><sense id="n42645.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarmătĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Sarmatians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sarmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 25, § 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42645.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Sarmatian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Black Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:207" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 207</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:5:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <trans><tr>the Sarmatians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:30:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:102:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 102, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:128" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the victory of Domitian over the Sarmatians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:6:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">braccae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:424" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mos loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:56" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 56</bibl></cit>; for <itype>which</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarmătĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like the Sarmatians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam didici Getice Sarmaticeque loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:12:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 58</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n42645.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarmătis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sarmatian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:82" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:10:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10, 110</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 3, 8: umbra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 114</bibl></cit>.—And in a Gr. form: <cit><quote lang="la">Sauromatides Amazones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 39</bibl>.<</sense></entryFree>
sarmatia: <entryFree id="n42646" type="main" key="Sarma^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarmătĭa, Sarmătĭcē, Sarmă-tĭcus</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarmătis</orth>, v. Sarmata.</entryFree>
sarmen: <entryFree id="n42647" type="hapax" key="sarmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sarpo</etym> (for the usu. sarmentum), <sense id="n42647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twigs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brushwood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarmenticius: <entryFree id="n42648" type="main" key="sarmenti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarmentīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sarmentum</etym>, <sense id="n42648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to twigs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cuttings</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">brushwood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:26:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sarmentīcĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Christians</hi>, who were burned with fagots, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarmentosus: <entryFree id="n42649" type="hapax" key="sarmento_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarmentōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of twigs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">little branches</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">psyllion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 90, § 140</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sarmentum: <entryFree id="n42650" type="main" key="sarmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sarpo</etym>, <sense id="n42650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twigs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light branches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brushwood; a fagot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fascine</hi> (class.; usu. in <number>plur.</number>; only so in Cic. and Cæs.; cf.: lignum, materia); <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:314" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 314</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:16" default="NO">5, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl> and 53; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27, § 69</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:150 al" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 72, § 150 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sarnus: <entryFree id="n42651" type="main" key="Sarnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Pompeii</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Sarno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 738</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:539" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 539</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:265" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 265</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saronicus: <entryFree id="n42652" type="main" key="Sa^ro_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sărōnĭcus sĭnus</orth>, <sense id="n42652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Saronic Gulf; a gulf of the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Attica and Peloponnesus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Gulf of Egina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 5, 9, § 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarpedon: <entryFree id="n42653" type="main" key="Sarpe_do_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarpēdōn</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sarphdw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n42653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Jupiter and Europa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Lycia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was killed by Patroclus before Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 106" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:112" default="NO">112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 100</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> 9, 697</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 471</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 255</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:10:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 10, 25</bibl>; Gr. <case>acc.</case> Sarpedona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:21:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 21, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42653.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory in Cilicia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lissan el Kahpe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 38, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarpo: <entryFree id="n42654" type="hapax" key="sarpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarpo</orth>, no <sense id="n42654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sarptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root sarp-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(rpa/zw</foreign></etym>; in agricult. lang., <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clean</hi>: sarpta vinea putata, id est pura facta: unde et virgulae <pb n="1632" /> <cb n="SASE" /> abscisae sarmenta. Sarpere enim antiqui pro purgare ponebant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=322" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 322</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
sarptus: <entryFree id="n42655" type="main" key="sarptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. sarpo.</entryFree>
sarra: <entryFree id="n42656" type="main" key="Sarra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarra</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sara</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 58</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Heb. Zor. <sense id="n42656.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The city of Tyre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Phœnicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its purple dye</hi>: Poenos Sarrā oriundos, Enn. ap. Prob. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 506</bibl>; cf. Serv. ad loc., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:6:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 6, 4</bibl>: purpuram ex Sarā tibi Attuli, Plaut. l. l.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n42656.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sarra</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n42656.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Tyrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:72" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leptis,</quote> <trans><tr>built by the Tyrians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:256" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 506</bibl></cit>; Col. poët. 10, 287; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">murex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:205" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aulaea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violae,</quote> <trans><tr>purple-red</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42656.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno (especially honored in Carthage),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:468" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:319" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:432" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sarracius: <entryFree id="n42657" type="main" key="sarra_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarrācĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>serra</etym>, <sense id="n42657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sawshaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serrate</hi> (late Lat.): lactuca, Dynam. 2, 52.</sense></entryFree>
sarracum: <entryFree id="n42658" type="main" key="sarra_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarrācum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">serrā-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n42658.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of wagon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cart</hi> (acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 21</bibl>, belonging to vulgar lang.), Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 195, 29</bibl>; Cic. Pis. Fragm. ap. Quint. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:255" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 255</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> M. Aurel. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42658.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the Wain</hi>, a constellation: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida Bootae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sarranus: <entryFree id="n42659" type="main" key="Sarra_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sarra.</entryFree>
sarrastes: <entryFree id="n42660" type="main" key="Sarrastes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarrastes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Sarnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 738</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:538" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 538</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarrio: <entryFree id="n42661" type="main" key="sarrio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarrio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sario</orth>), <itype>ŭi and īvi</itype> (the former in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 161, 2</bibl>; the latter in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 10</bibl>), <itype>ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>; in agricult. lang., <sense id="n42661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hoe</hi> the soil, plants, etc., for the purpose of destroying weeds; <hi rend="ital">to weed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 161, 1</bibl> and 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:29:1" default="NO">1, 29, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:9" default="NO">11, 2, 9</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 21, 50, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:158" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 17, 45, § 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 7, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarritio: <entryFree id="n42662" type="main" key="sarri_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarrītĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sarītĭo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sartĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sarrio</etym>, <sense id="n42662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hoeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weeding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:9" default="NO">11, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarritor: <entryFree id="n42663" type="main" key="sarri_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarrītor</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sartor</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n42663.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hoer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weeder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:29:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n42663.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sator sartorque scelerum et messor maxime,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cultivator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sarritorius: <entryFree id="n42664" type="hapax" key="sarri_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarrītōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sarīt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to hoeing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weeding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:13:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sarritura: <entryFree id="n42665" type="main" key="sarri_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarrītūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sarīt-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hoeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a weeding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 27</bibl>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sartūra</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 27, 67, § 254</bibl>; cf.: sarritor and sarritio.</sense></entryFree>
sarritus: <entryFree id="n42666" type="main" key="sarri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from sarrio.</entryFree>
sarsina: <entryFree id="n42667" type="main" key="Sarsi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarsĭna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sassĭna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n42667.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient town in Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Plautus</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Sarsina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:59:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 59, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:463" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 463</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42667.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarsĭnātis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sassĭnas</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4404</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sarsina</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sassinate de silvā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:35" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 35</bibl></cit>.—In a lusus verbb., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 83</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sarsĭnātes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sass-</orth>), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sarsina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sarsurius: <entryFree id="n42668" type="main" key="sarsu_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sarsūrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sartor</etym>, <sense id="n42668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patching</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> Arch. Reg. ad Virg. 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sartago: <entryFree id="n42669" type="main" key="sarta_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sartāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n42669.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A frying-pan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baking-pan</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 22, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 100, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 7, 9</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n42669.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sartago loquendi,</quote> <trans><tr>a hotchpotch</tr>, <tr>mixture</tr>, <tr>medley</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:80" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sartatecta: <entryFree id="n42670" type="main" key="sarta^tecta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sartătecta</orth>, v. <itype>sarcio</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
sarte: <entryFree id="n42671" type="gloss" key="sarte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sartē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sarcio, <sense id="n42671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sartor: <entryFree id="n42672" type="gloss" key="sartor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sartor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sarcio</etym>, <sense id="n42672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a patcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">botcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mender</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 7, 28</bibl>: sartoris arte se pascere, Aug. Civ. Dei, 22, 8, n. 10.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n42673" type="main" key="sartor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sartor</orth>, v. sarritor, II.</entryFree>
sartrix: <entryFree id="n42674" type="main" key="sartrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sartrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sartor</etym>, <sense id="n42674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who patches</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mends</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:9:100" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 9, 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sartura: <entryFree id="n42675" type="main" key="sartu_ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sartūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sarcio</etym>, <sense id="n42675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a patching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mending</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 26, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarturae veteris lintei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 25, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n42676" type="main" key="sartu_ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sartūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. sarritura.</entryFree>
sartus: <entryFree id="n42677" type="main" key="sartus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sartus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of sarcio.</entryFree>
sas: <entryFree id="n42678" type="main" key="sas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sas</orth> = suas, v. suus <sense id="n42678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
saserna: <entryFree id="n42679" type="main" key="Saserna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saserna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a friend of Antony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 13, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42679.1" n="II" level="1"> Sasernae, <hi rend="ital">father and son</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Latin writers on</hi> <cb n="SATI" /> <hi rend="ital">agriculture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:18:2" default="NO">1, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:5:2:22" default="NO">5, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saso: <entryFree id="n42680" type="main" key="Sa_so"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Sāson</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sa/swn, *sa/sw</foreign>, <sense id="n42680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island near the promontory Acroceraunia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the coast of Illyria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Saseno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 627</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:650" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 650</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:480" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 480</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sassina: <entryFree id="n42681" type="main" key="Sassi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sassĭna</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sassĭnas</orth>, v. Sarsina.</entryFree>
sassius: <entryFree id="n42682" type="main" key="Sassi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sassĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n42682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. —<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sassĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of the mother of Cluentius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">62, 175</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
sassula: <entryFree id="n42683" type="main" key="Sassu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sassŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood of Tibur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sat: <entryFree id="n42684" type="main" key="sa^t"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săt</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. satis.</entryFree>
sata: <entryFree id="n42685" type="main" key="sa^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">săta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 1. sero, I. A.</entryFree>
satagito: <entryFree id="n42686" type="main" key="sa^ta^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătăgĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. satis, II. A.</entryFree>
satagius: <entryFree id="n42687" type="hapax" key="sa^ta^gi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătăgĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>satago</etym>, <sense id="n42687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that troubles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vexes himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over-anxious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut istos satagios ac sibi molestos describam tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 98:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 98, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
satago: <entryFree id="n42688" type="main" key="sa^ta^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătăgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. satis, II. B.</entryFree>
satanariaherba: <entryFree id="n42689" type="main" key="satanaria herba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">satanaria herba</orth>, <sense id="n42689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> peucedanos, <hi rend="ital">sulphurwort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hog</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-fennel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satanas: <entryFree id="n42690" type="main" key="Sa^ta^nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătănas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătan</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*satana=s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*sata=n</foreign> (Heb. <foreign />), <sense id="n42690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an adversary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Satan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Devil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 22 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 4, 10</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">form Satan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:19:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Reg. 19, 22</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
satelles: <entryFree id="n42691" type="main" key="sa^telle^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătellĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <sense id="n42691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attendant</hi> upon a distinguished person, esp. a prince, <hi rend="ital">a lifeguard;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">attendants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retinue</hi> (class.; syn.: stipator, apparitor, accensus). </sense><sense id="n42691.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">regii satellites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:36" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 36</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">administri et satellites Sex. Naevii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25, 80</bibl></cit> (cf. infra, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">habet sectatores vel potius satellites, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliosum foret, si equites Romani satellites Numidae traderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 65:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 65, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sullae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 41, 2</bibl></cit> Dietsch; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequimini satellites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum per medios ire satellites... amat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne posset adire, Cursus equi fecit circumfususque satelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sejani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalis,</quote> <trans><tr>followers</tr>, <tr>satellites</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:28" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42691.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), of <hi rend="ital">attendants</hi> analog. to the preceding: Jovis pinnata satelles, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the eagle</hi>, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 47, 106; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Tusc. 2:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 24</bibl>: Noctis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the evening-star</hi>, id. poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 65, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orci,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Charon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 34</bibl></cit>: Neptuni, <hi rend="ital">storms</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 14</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the attendants</hi> of the queen-bee, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 17, § 53</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">Orion</hi>, as Diana's attendant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:538" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 538</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42691.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an assistant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attendant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem natura non solum celeritate mentis ornavit, sed etiam sensus tamquam satellites attribuit ac nuncios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis verae custos rigidusque satelles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—In Cicero more freq. in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">an assistant in crime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an accomplice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abettor</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">stipatores corporis constituit, eosdem ministros et satellites potestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satellites scelerum, ministros cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Mallium, audaciae satellitem atque administrum tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatum satellites et ministras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">(opp. dominatrix),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
satellitium: <entryFree id="n42692" type="main" key="sa^telli^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătellĭtĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>satelles</etym>, <sense id="n42692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an escort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convoy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 1, 17</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">scripturarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 3:18" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 3, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
satianter: <entryFree id="n42693" type="main" key="sa^ti^anter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. satio <sense id="n42693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
satias: <entryFree id="n42694" type="main" key="sa^ti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭes</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 637</bibl>: <sense id="n42694.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">ad satiem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 216</bibl></cit>; <case>abl.</case> satie, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 209</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>satis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a sufficiency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plentifulness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42694.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (mostly ante- and post-class.; not found in Cic. or Cæs.; commonly used only in <hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi>, the other cases being taken from satietas): quorum crudelitatem numquam ulla explet satias sanguinis, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 7</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 133 Rib.); cf. id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 90</bibl> (v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 70</bibl> P., and l. l. p. 188 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">fessus satiate videndi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1038" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1038</bibl></cit>: haec juvabant Cum satiate cibi, <hi rend="ital">along with abundance of food</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">after eating sufficiently</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1391</bibl>: ut hodie ad litationem huic suppetat satias Jovi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 100</bibl>: frumenti ex inopiā gravi satias facta, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 13</bibl> (Hist. 2, 29 Dietsch): fructibus omnium <cb n="SATI" /> generum ita subnascentibus ut numquam satias voluptatibus desit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad satiatem terra ferarum Nunc etiam scatit,</quote> <trans><tr>in abundance</tr>, <tr>abundantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42694.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., subject., <hi rend="ital">satisfied desire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satiety; a loathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgust</hi> (ante-class. and since the Aug. period, but not in Quint.; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, on the other hand, satietas): satias jam tenet Studiorum istorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: omnium rerum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicubi eum satias Hominum aut negoti si quando odium ceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; so (corresp. with odium) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">(with taedium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte jam satias amoris in uxore ex multā copiā cepisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 3</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satias capit aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satiate: <entryFree id="n42695" type="main" key="sa^ti^a_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. satio <sense id="n42695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin. adv.</hi> b.</sense></entryFree>
saticula: <entryFree id="n42696" type="main" key="Sa^ti_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Samnium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the frontiers of Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">S. Agata dei Goti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:39" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42696.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătīcŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Saticula</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătīcŭlā-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Saticula</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Saticulans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42696.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătīcŭ-lus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Saticulan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asper (collectively),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 729</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saties: <entryFree id="n42697" type="main" key="sa^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. satias <sense id="n42697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
satietas: <entryFree id="n42698" type="main" key="sa^ti^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>satis</etym>, <sense id="n42698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sufficiency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi> (syn. saturitas). </sense><sense id="n42698.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">neque ulla ornandi satis satietas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus terrenis principiorum satietatibus abundans, parumque habens umoris et aëris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 9, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42698.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., subject., <hi rend="ital">the state of being glutted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sated; a loathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satiety</hi> (class. and very freq., esp. in the trop. sense and with Cicero; syn. fastidium). </sense><sense id="n42698.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi satietas et fastidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:17:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amarum ad satietatem usque oggerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad satietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:165" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 17, 49, § 165</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra satietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 6, 57, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ea, quae leviter sensum voluptate moveant, facillime fugiant satietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 26, 40, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 34, 40, § 116</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * </sense><sense id="n42698.4" n="2" level="3"> Concr., the superfluity, refuse of the food eaten, i. e. <hi rend="ital">excrements</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2, § 33</bibl> (cf. saturitas, II.
