C.).—</sense><sense id="n42698.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficile dictu est, quaenam causa sit, cur ea, quae maxime sensus nostros impellunt voluptate et specie primā acerrime commovent, ab iis celerrime fastidio quodam et satietate abalienemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 98</bibl></cit>; so (with fastidium) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">(with taedium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:143" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hac hominum satietate nostri discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satietas provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderium quietis et satietas gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante inimicos satietas poenarum suarum cepisset quam, etc. (shortly before: poenarum ex inimicis satis est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satietatem amoris sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satietatem parere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 27, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiorum omnium satietas vitae facit satietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 20, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincere aurium satietatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 174</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut varietas satietati occurreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:174" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 52, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus in rebus similitudo est satietatis mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:41:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 41, 76</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">similitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 41, 177</bibl></cit> (cf. 1. satio, II. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">te deseret ille aetate et satietate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo usque satietatem dum capiet pater Illius quam amat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad satietatem osculis frui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">non debent esse amicitiarum sicut aliarum rerum satietates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
satin: <entryFree id="n42699" type="main" key="sa^ti^n'"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭn'</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭne</orth> for satisne; v. satis <sense id="n42699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
satio: <entryFree id="n42700" type="main" key="sa^ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>satis</etym>, <sense id="n42700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfy; to sate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satiate</hi> with food (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense; syn. saturo). </sense><sense id="n42700.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiat semimodius cibi in diebus singulis vicenos et centenos turtures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (orca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desideria naturae,</quote> <trans><tr>to satisfy</tr>, <tr>appease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:35:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 371</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiati agm ludunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes sanguine erili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultur humano cadavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42700.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to fill sufficiently; to saturate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impregnate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish<pb n="1633" /> <cb n="SATI" />  abundantly</hi> with any thing (not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">solum stercore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietem palea, Petr. poët. 135, 8, 8: Tyrium colorem pelagio,</quote> <trans><tr>to saturate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 836</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Nilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odoribus ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 758</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robora Dalmatico lucent satiata metallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:153" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumine Phoebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:36:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 36, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42700.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">content; to glut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satiate</hi> a desire (in a good or bad sense): <cit><quote lang="la">in ejus corpore lacerando ac vexando cum animum satiare non posset, oculos paverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">explere bonis rebus satiareque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1004" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1004</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim expletur umquam nec satiatur cupiditatis sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 27, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the foll: populum libertate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funeribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aviditatem legendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiari delectatione non possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec satiare queunt spectando corpora coram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1098" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1098</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum satiaverit iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina longo visu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:34" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 34</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiatis et expletis jucundius est carere quam frui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait se nequaquam esse satiatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:28:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 28, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiatus somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiatus poenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppliciis satiati nocentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido mentis satiata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira satiata caedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 803</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrum cognitionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu nimis longo satiate ludo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (on account of satis, or also in analogy with expletus): <cit><quote lang="la">cum satiata ferinae Dextera caedis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 808</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiata sanguinis hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:437" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satiatus et aevi Et decoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:605" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 605</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42700.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., subject., <hi rend="ital">to overfill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloy; to satiate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgust; pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be cloyed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wearied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgusted</hi> with a thing (rare but class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">satias, II., and satietas, II. B.): secretae (figurae) ut novitate excitant, ita copia satiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum numerus agnoscitur, deinde satiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:64:215" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 64, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum vicissitudines efficient, ut neque ii satientur, qui audient, fastidio similitudinis, nec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 193</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41, 177</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudinis satietate defatigetur, v. satietas, II. B.): agricola assiduo satiatus aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:51" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senem et prosperis adversisque satiatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Domitianus) secreto suo satiatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— Hence, <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>: * </sense><sense id="n42700.5" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sufficiently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to satiety</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad satietatem, affatim): equi satianter pasti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 195, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42700.6" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sufficiently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to satiety</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tilia ignis et aëris habendo satiate atque umoris temperate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. satietas, I.): <cit><quote lang="la">eadem dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera Hermippus satiatissime exhibebit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Mus. 4:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Mus. 4, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42701" type="main" key="sa^ti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. sero</etym>, <sense id="n42701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a planting</hi> (syn. sementis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:39:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 39, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:14:2" default="NO">3, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:80" default="NO">11, 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:319 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 319 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">sowed fields</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivated lands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 15, § 38</bibl>; Vulg.Ecclus. 40, 22.</sense></entryFree>
satira: <entryFree id="n42702" type="main" key="sa^ti^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. satur <sense id="n42702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
satiricus: <entryFree id="n42703" type="main" key="sa^ti^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭrĭcus</orth> (on account of the confusion of the Roman Satira with the Greek Satyros, often erroneously written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătyrĭcus</orth>; hence in the <sense id="n42703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> even with a Greek ending, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătyrĭcon</orth>; cf. satirographus), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>satira</etym>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> (Roman) <hi rend="ital">satire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satiric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satirical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satirici carminis scriptor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:168" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 168</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42703.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">să-tĭrĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a writer of satires</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a satirist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42703.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătĭrĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work of Petronius.</hi></sense></entryFree>
satirographus: <entryFree id="n42704" type="main" key="sa^ti^ro^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭrŏgrăphus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sătyrŏgr-</orth>; v. satiricus <sense id="n42704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">saturogra/fos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a writer of satires</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a satirist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satis: <entryFree id="n42705" type="main" key="sa^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătis</orth>, <itype>and abbreviated</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">săt</orth> (cf. the letter S.: satin', contr. for satisne; v.the foll.), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>root in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/dhn, a(/dhn</foreign>, orig. a comp. form, weakened from satius; cf.: magis, nimis, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n42705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sufficiently</hi> (objectively, so that one needs nothing more; whereas affatim subjectively, so that one wishes nothing more). </sense><sense id="n42705.1" n="I" level="1"> Posit. </sense><sense id="n42705.2" n="1" level="3"> Adject., <hi rend="ital">enough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sufficient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfactory.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42705.3" n="a" level="4"> Form <cb n="SATI" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătis</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (faenum et pabulum) bubus satis siet, qui illic sient,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 137</bibl></cit>: cui, si conjuret populus, vix totu' satis sit, <hi rend="ital">were enough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adequate</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 193</bibl> P.: libram aiebant satis esse ambobus farris Intritae, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 81, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo talenta pro re nostrā ego esse decrevi satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies mihi hic ut sit satis vereor Ad agendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid adjecissent ipsi terroris satis ad perniciem fore rati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo satis haec vestigia parva sagaci Sunt, per quae possis cognoscere cetera tute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis est tibi in te, satis in legibus, satis in mediocribus amicitiis praesidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semper vobis auxilium adversus inimicos satis sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis esse Italiae unum consulem censebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:38:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 38, 92</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse Romam venirem, si satis consilium quādam de re haberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id modo si mercedis Datur mihi... satis Mihi esse ducam,</quote> <trans><tr>will content myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis hoc tibi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo istuc satis est, auribus non satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:215" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicebant de re publicā quod esset illis viris et consulari dignitati satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 35, 135</bibl></cit>; hence, in a play on the word: <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Jam satis est mihi. <hi rend="ital">Li.</hi> Tum igitur tu dives es factus? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidvis satis est, dum vivat modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non sentirent, quid esset satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 22, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sum avidior etiam, quam satis est, gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus quam satis doleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel fugiendi si data est occasio, Satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis esse deberet, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 41, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satin' habes, si feminarum nulla'st, quam aeque diligam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars satis praestat, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non satis efficit oratio, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis superque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenas dedit usque superque Quam satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis superque habere dicit, quod sibi ab arbitrio tribuatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta repente caelo missa vis aquae, ut ea modo exercitui satis superque foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 75:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 75, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis una excidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 642</bibl></cit> (v. infra, <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign> and 2. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plura quam satis est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra quam satis est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Satis est (habeo, credo, etc.), with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or a <hi rend="ital">subject-</hi> (<hi rend="ital">object-</hi>) <hi rend="ital">clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic satis illud erit planum facere atque probare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 934</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis erat respondere Magnas: ingentes, inquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut satis sit, scire ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si oratori satis esset docere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc libertatem repeti satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos satis habebatis animam retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud satis habeo dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: satis habeo with <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Timol. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 38</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 29, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:8:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 8, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis putant vitio carere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si res nudas atque inornatas indicare satis videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herennium et Numisium legatos vinciri satis visum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 59</bibl></cit>. —Rarely with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabio satis visum, ut ovans urbem iniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—Negatively: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (rerum) unam dicere causam Non satis est, verum plures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero habere virtutem satis est, nisi utare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera exstruentibus satis non est, saxa atque materiam congerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: non satis est, pulchra esse poëmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 99</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Zumpt, Gram. § 590): nunc satis est dixisse: ego mira poëmata pango, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod hactenus ostendisse satis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque id viro bono satis est, docuisse quod sciret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud notasse satis habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—Negatively: <cit><quote lang="la">non ille satis cognosse Sabinae Gentis habet ritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non satis credunt excepisse quae relicta erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: gaudeo. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Satis credo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.: As.</hi> Salve. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Satis mihi est tuae salutis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis historiarum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis mihi id habeam supplicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea amicitia non satis habet firmitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dicendum temporis satis habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 15</bibl>: satis praesidii, <cb n="SATI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 84</bibl> Madv. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis poenarum dedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam satis terris nivis atque dirae Grandinis misit pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis superque esse sibi suarum cuique rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 45</bibl></cit>; so, satis superque, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:63:67:3" default="NO" valid="yes">63, 67, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 32, 6</bibl>; 28, 29, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 19</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: satius; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, B. —</sense><sense id="n42705.6" n="b" level="4"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">săt</orth> (most freq. in the poets): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (dis) sat esse non queam?</quote> <trans><tr>to be sufficient</tr>, <tr>equal to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pol vel legioni sat est (obsonium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jure causam dicito, hic verbum sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum quantum sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum sat habes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amabo jam sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene plus quam sat erat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sat habeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 22</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n42705.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Sat est (habeo, credo, etc.), with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or a <hi rend="ital">subject-</hi> (<hi rend="ital">object-</hi>) <hi rend="ital">clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne id sat erat, Accipere ab illo injuriam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdere posse sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 75</bibl></cit>: qui non sat habuit conjugem illexe in stuprum, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sat habet favitorum semper, qui recte facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 79</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ar.</hi> Mater salve. <hi rend="ital">Art.</hi> Sat salutis't, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 10</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n42705.9" n="2" level="3"> Adverb., <hi rend="ital">enough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sufficiently.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42705.10" n="a" level="4"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătis</orth>. </sense><sense id="n42705.11" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sis sanus, aut sapias satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis deludere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis jam dolui ex animo et curā me satis Et lacrimis maceravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satin' me illi hodie scelesti ceperunt dolo?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego istuc satis scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis ostenderit, reliquos, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit> et saep.: quod bruti nec satis sardare queunt, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=322" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 322</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque audio neque oculis prospicio satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra Epicurum satis superque dictum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:31" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 31</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quidque furor valeat, Penthea caede satisque Ac super ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 429</bibl></cit> (v. in the foll. II. D. 1. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>).—</sense><sense id="n42705.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adjectives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis multa restant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:44:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 44, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video te testimoniis satis instructum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura tibi magna satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 48</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis superque humilis est, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Sometimes, like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">enough</hi>, it denotes diminution, <hi rend="ital">tolerably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videor mihi nostrum illum consularem exercitum bonorum omnium, etiam satis bonorum, habere firmissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis litteratus (with nec infacetus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis bonus (locus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res satis amplae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign> and b. <foreign lang="greek">b.</foreign>—</sense><sense id="n42705.13" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adverbs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adverbial phrases</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis audacter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis certo scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis superbe illuditis me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis scite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non satis honeste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis cum periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 104</bibl></cit>: et quidem hercle formā luculentā (haec meretrix). <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Sic satis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis opportune occidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis recte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis bene ornatae,</quote> <trans><tr>dressed well enough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 73</bibl></cit>; hence satis bene sometimes, like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">well enough</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">tolerably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderately</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pretty well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo (Catone) cum quaereretur, quid maxime in re familiari expediret? respondit: Bene pascere. Quid secundum? Satis bene pascere. Quid tertium? Male pascere. Quid quartum? Arare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:25:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 25, 89</bibl></cit> (for which, in the same narration, mediocriter pascere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6</bibl>, praef. § 4; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 5, 6, § 30</bibl>); cf. supra, a. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>, and infra, b. <foreign lang="greek">b.</foreign>—</sense><sense id="n42705.14" n="b" level="4"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">săt</orth>. </sense><sense id="n42705.15" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sat scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sat prata biberunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adjectives</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusator sat bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sat idoneus Pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 26</bibl></cit>: sat planum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Signifying diminution, like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">enough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tolerably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetantibus omnibus bonis, etiam sat bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; so, sat bonus (less than bonus): <pb n="1634" /> <cb n="SATI" /> sl me voltis esse oratorem, si etiam sat bonum, si bonum denique, non repugnabo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:22:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 22, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.17" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adverbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sat diu vixisse sese arbitrabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sat commode,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sat recte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.18" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: satius (prop. more satisfying; hence), <hi rend="ital">better</hi>, <hi rend="ital">more serviceable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preferable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42705.19" n="1" level="3"> Adject., in the phrase satius est, with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi> (cf. supra, 1. a. <foreign lang="greek">b,</foreign> and b. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>) followed by <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire satius est quam loqui Servum hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:32:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 32, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:23" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 23</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> al.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio satius est, ut opu'st, te ita esse, quam ut animo lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto satius est, te id dare operam ... Quam id loqui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: satius multo fuisse, non moveri bellum adversus eum, quam omitti motum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne fuit satius tristis Amaryllidis iras pati?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos te satius est docere, ut, quando agas, quid agant, sciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mori me satius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 63</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">repertus est nemo, qui mori diceret satius esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:36:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 36, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuom hercle me duco satius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga impugnare hostium satius visum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 34</bibl>.—In a positive signif., <hi rend="ital">it serves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benefits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is of use</hi>: nihil <foreign lang="greek">fluarei=n</foreign> satius est, miles (perh. in reference to the preceding speech of the miles: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuum me duco satius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 36</bibl></cit>: satius putare, with an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to believe it to be better</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5, 1</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n42705.20" n="2" level="3"> Adverb., with a <hi rend="ital">verb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather</hi> (syn. potius): <cit><quote lang="la">ego quod magis pertineat ad Fundanii valetudinem, satius dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n42705.21" n="II" level="1"> Particular phrases. </sense><sense id="n42705.22" n="A" level="2"> Sat agito (also in one word, satagito), and sat agere suarum rerum, <hi rend="ital">to have enough to do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hands full; to be busy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be troubled</hi> (only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc agitas sat tute tuarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is quoque suarum rerum sat agitat, tamen, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit> Bentl., followed by Umpfenb.; and so ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 193</bibl> P. (Fleck. sat agit, tamen).—</sense><sense id="n42705.23" n="B" level="2"> Satis ago or sat ago (also in one word, satago). </sense><sense id="n42705.24" n="1" level="3"> T. t. in business lang., <hi rend="ital">to satisfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">content</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pay</hi> a creditor: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc satagit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 34</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42705.25" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To have enough to do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hands full; to be in trouble</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word). </sense><sense id="n42705.26" n="(a)" level="5"> Form satis ago (class.): jam apud vallum nostri satis agebant, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 193</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Pyrrhus rex in terrā Italiā esset satisque agerent Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego nocte hac proximā In somnis egi satis et fui homo exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complorantibus omnibus nostris atque in sentinā satis agentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:11:4" default="NO">9, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis agentes rerum suarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 209, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnatur acriter: agitur tamen satii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.27" n="(b)" level="5"> Form sat ago (satago) (very rare): Caesar alte-ram alam mittit, qui satagentibus celeriter occurrerent, Auct. B. Afr. 78, 7; cf. supra, II. A.—</sense><sense id="n42705.28" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bustle about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a to-do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be full of business</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">polupragmoneu/w</foreign> (postAug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">(Domitius) Afer venuste Mallium Suram multum in agendo discursantem, salientem, manus jactantem, etc. ... non agere dixit, sed satagere. Est enim dictum per se urbanum satagere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curris, stupes, satagis tamquam mus in matellā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58, 9</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: interea haec satagens, <hi rend="ital">busily doing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">performing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 137, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.29" n="C" level="2"> Satis accipio, caveo, do, exigo, peto, offero, etc., t: t. of business lang., <hi rend="ital">to take</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">sufficient bail</hi> or <hi rend="ital">security</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis accipio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 13, 44 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:4" default="NO">45, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:33" default="NO">46, 1, 33</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis acceptum habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be fully assured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis caveo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:60" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 60</bibl></cit> (cf. caveo, II. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">satis do (also as one word, satisdo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 13, 44 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 56, § 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 24, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 28</bibl>, a, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:7" default="NO">1, 2, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 36, 4, 1; 36, 4, 5; 46, 6, 1.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicatae pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damni infecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei commissi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:4:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:4:5" default="NO">46, 4, 5</bibl>: satisdato (caveo, promitto, <cb n="SATI" /> debeo, etc.), <hi rend="ital">by giving bail</hi> or <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:4" default="NO">2, 11, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 40, 5, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis exigo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:18" default="NO">36, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis offero,</quote> <trans><tr>to tender security</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 26, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:4:3" default="NO">36, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:17:1" default="NO">48, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis peto,</quote> <trans><tr>to demand security</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:70" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 35, 1, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.30" n="D" level="2"> Sătis făcĭo, or, in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătisfăcĭo</orth> (<hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> satisfacitur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 789</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">to give satisfaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to satisfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">content</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satisfacere dicimur ei, cujus desiderium implemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n42705.31" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n42705.32" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illis satis facerem ex disciplinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:53:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 53, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui petenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:41:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 41, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam dabo ut tibi satisfaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deo pie et caste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domino vel populo (gladiatores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">77</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aut morte aut victoriā se satisfacturum rei publicae spopondisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (vitae meae) satis feci vel aetate vel factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me omnibus satis esse facturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae atque officio satis facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis officio meo, satis illorum voluntati, qui a me hoc petiverunt, factum esse arbitrabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravibus seriisque rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi nullo modo poterit oratio mea satis facere vestrae scientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 23, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui et naturae et legibus satis fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me plus satis nostrae conjunctioni amorique facturum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnium vel suspicioni vel malevolentiae vel crudelitati satis fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:17:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi vero satis superque abs te videtur istorum studiis ... esse factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se avarissimi hominis cupiditati satis facere posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidini alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 11, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntati voluntate satisfecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:35:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:77" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.33" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (histriones) in dissimillimis personis satisfaciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:31:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 31, 109</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in historiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jure civili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.34" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus quoniam satisfeci me nihil reliqui fecisse, quod ad sanandum me pertineret, reliquum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.35" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem tandem non satisfacit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos plene et statim de eo satis esse facturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.36" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n42705.37" n="a" level="4"> T. t. of business lang., <hi rend="ital">to satisfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">content</hi> (by payment or security), <hi rend="ital">to pay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">secure</hi> a creditor: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia petitur ab Hermippo: Hermippus ab Heraclide petit, ipse tamen Fufiis satisfacit absentibus et fidem suam liberat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de visceribus tuis et filii tui satis facturus sis quibus debes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: ut si mihi in pecuniā minus satisfecisset, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis pecunia exsoluta esse debet aut eo nomine satisfactum esse: satisfactum autem accipimus, quemadmodum voluit creditor, licet non sit solutum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; so (opp. solvere) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:19" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stichus servus meus heredi meo mille nummos si solverit, satisve fecerit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:4:41" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 4, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:39:section=1" default="NO">40, 7, 39, § 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. of the thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui ususfructus legatus esset, donec ei totius dotis (sc. nomine) satis fieret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.38" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To give satisfaction</hi> (by word or deed); <hi rend="ital">to make amends</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reparation; to make excuse; to ask pardon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apologize</hi> to a person offended, injured, etc. </sense><sense id="n42705.39" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut satisfaciat mihi ille, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Aeduis de injuriis ... item si Allobrogibus satisfaciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde reliquae legiones per tribunos militum egerunt, ut Caesari satisfacerent, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acceperam jam ante Caesaris litteras, ut mihi satisfieri paterer a te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:20:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 20, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.40" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus rationibus de injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.41" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriarum satisfecisti L. Labieno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 27, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42705.42" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">missis ad Caesarem satisfaciundi causā legatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā civitate legatus populi Romani aliquā ex parte violatus sit, nisi publice satis factum sit, el civitati bellum indici atque inferri solere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:31:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 31, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satisfacientes aut supplicantes summittimus (manus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:115" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 115</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n42705.43" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To give satisfaction by suffering a penalty</hi>: <cb n="SATR" /> saepe satisfecit praedae venator, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:14:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 14, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satisacceptio: <entryFree id="n42706" type="hapax" key="sa^ti^saccepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭsacceptĭo</orth> (or separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭs acceptĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>satis-accipio; v. satis, II. C.</etym>, <sense id="n42706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking of security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admitting to bail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satisdatio: <entryFree id="n42707" type="main" key="sa^tisda^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătisdătĭo</orth> (or separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătis dă-tĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>satis-do; v. satis, II. C.</etym>. <sense id="n42707.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The satisfaction of a creditor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:49" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 49</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42707.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A giving of bail</hi> or <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:8:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:28" default="NO">4, 6, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:5:1" default="NO">46, 5, 1</bibl>; 50, 16, 61; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:200" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 200</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: capitalis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a pledging of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">answering with one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satisdato: <entryFree id="n42708" type="main" key="sa^tisda^to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătisdătō</orth>, v. satis, II. C.</entryFree>
satisdator: <entryFree id="n42709" type="main" key="sa^tisda^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătisdător</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>satis-do; v. satis, II. C.</etym>, <sense id="n42709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who gives security; a surety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bail</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Ps.<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Verr. 2:1:45" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satisdo: <entryFree id="n42710" type="main" key="sa^tisdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătisdo</orth>, v. satis, II. C.</entryFree>
satisfacio: <entryFree id="n42711" type="main" key="sa^tisfa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătisfăcĭo</orth>, v. satis, II. D.</entryFree>
satisfactio: <entryFree id="n42712" type="main" key="sa^tisfactio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătisfactio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>satisfacio; v. satis, II. D.</etym>. * <sense id="n42712.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A satisfying</hi> of a creditor by security; <hi rend="ital">a giving security</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satisfactio pro solutione est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 52</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42712.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An excuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apology</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explanation</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesar) Ubiorum satisfactionem accepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tu me etiam insimulas, nec satisfactionem meam accipis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne aliquid satisfactio levitatis habere videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satisfactionem ex nullā conscientiā de culpā proponere decrevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 35, 2</bibl></cit> Kritz.—</sense><sense id="n42712.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Satisfaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reparation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amends</hi>, for an injury, etc. (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">luitur homicidium certo pecorum numero, recipitque satisfactionem universa domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of doves, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satisfactionalis: <entryFree id="n42713" type="main" key="sa^tisfacti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătisfactĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>satisfactio</etym>, <sense id="n42713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making amends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apologetic</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">liber (with apologeticus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
satius: <entryFree id="n42714" type="main" key="sa^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭus</orth>, v. satis, I. B.</entryFree>
sativus: <entryFree id="n42715" type="main" key="sa^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. sero</etym>, <sense id="n42715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is sown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">planted</hi> (opp. agrestis, silvestris, etc., that grows wild; very rare), Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 73, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 2, 11, § 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sativa (opp. silvestria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 12, 60, § 185</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sator: <entryFree id="n42716" type="main" key="sa^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sător</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n42716.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">planter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:45:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 45, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:50:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 50, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42716.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a begetter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creator</hi>: caelestum sator, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Jupiter</hi>, Cic. poët.
