Tusc. 2, 9, 21; <cit><quote lang="la">also termed hominum sator atque deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 254</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 725</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum (with deorum genitor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 17, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:432" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:306" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verus Alcidae sator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 357" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annorum nitidique mundi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Janus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:28:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui et sator omnium deorum fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42716.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promoter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): sator sartorque scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: turbarum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:260" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 260</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satorius: <entryFree id="n42717" type="main" key="sa^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">planting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trimodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:8" default="NO">12, 52, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satrapea: <entryFree id="n42718" type="main" key="sa^tra^pe_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătrăpēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. satrapes <sense id="n42718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
satrapes: <entryFree id="n42719" type="foreign" key="sa^tra^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătrăpes</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sătraps</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătră-pa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<number>plur.</number> satrapae), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">satra/phs</foreign> [Persian; cf. Gesenius, under <foreign />], <sense id="n42719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a governor of a province</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a viceroy</hi> among the Persians, <hi rend="ital">a satrap; nom.</hi> satrapes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satrapa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satraps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 6, 392</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> satrapis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 4, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> satrapen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satrapam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. nom.</hi> satrapae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 6, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">satrapes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> satraparum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 119</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> satrapas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 3, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> satrapis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 29, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> satrapibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 2:21" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 2, 21</bibl>.—Hence, gen., <hi rend="ital">a ruler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satrapae Philistinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 9, 14</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">satră-pĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">satrăpēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">satrapeia,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">the office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">province of a satrap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a satrapy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:44" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:5" default="NO">6, 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satraps: <entryFree id="n42720" type="main" key="satraps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">satraps</orth>, <itype>pis</itype>, v. satrapes <sense id="n42720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
satricum: <entryFree id="n42721" type="main" key="Satri^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Satrĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n42721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Appian Way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Antium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Casale di Conca</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 4</bibl>; <pb n="1635" /> <cb n="SATU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 22</bibl>; 9, 16.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sa-trĭcāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Satricum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satricus: <entryFree id="n42722" type="main" key="Sa^tri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătrĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:68 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 68 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
satullo: <entryFree id="n42723" type="hapax" key="sa^tullo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătullo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>satullus</etym>, <sense id="n42723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to satisfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satiate</hi>: cibis corpora, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 171, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satullus: <entryFree id="n42724" type="hapax" key="sa^tullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătullus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n42724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [satur], <hi rend="ital">filled</hi> with food, <hi rend="ital">satisfied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agni satulli lacte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
satum: <entryFree id="n42725" type="main" key="satum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">satum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/ton,</foreign> <sense id="n42725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Hebrew measure</hi> of corn, etc., containing about a modius and a half (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 18, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 13, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 13, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satur: <entryFree id="n42726" type="main" key="sa^tur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătur</orth>, <itype>ŭra, ŭrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>satis</etym>, <sense id="n42726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full</hi> of food, <hi rend="ital">sated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that has eaten enough</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n42726.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi satur sum (opp. quando esurio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; so (opp. esurientes) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 6 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopor quem satur aut lassus capias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:957" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 957</bibl></cit>: esurientibus pullis res geri poterit; <cit><quote lang="la">saturis nihil geretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam isti a mensā surgunt saturi, poti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tu satura atque ebria eris, puer ut satur sit facito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so (with ebrius and crudus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et exacto contentus tempore vita Cedat, uti conviva satur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">histrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:79:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 79, 1</bibl></cit>.—Humorously, of a pregnant woman, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42726.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non edistis, saturi fite fabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedes suco ambrosiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nepos anseris extis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:71" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42726.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam intus sum omnium rerum satur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rerum (with plenus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:960" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 960</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnus saturior lactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42726.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n42726.5" n="1" level="3"> Of color, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera saturo fucata colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(purpura) quo melior saturiorque est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:5:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes Tyrio saturae ostro,</quote> <trans><tr>richly dyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 956" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 956</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42726.6" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">well filled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full; rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesepia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 197</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:71" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctumnus, Col. poët. 10, 43: messes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:Aetn. 12" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> Aetn. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locis ob umidam caeli naturam saturis et redundantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42726.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fatted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves paludis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:52:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 52, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42726.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi> (opp. dry, simple; very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the two foll. passages): nec satura jejune, nec grandia minute (dicet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 36, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>various</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 474</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. lanx), orig., <hi rend="ital">a dish filled with various kinds of fruits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plate of fruit;</hi> hence, also, <hi rend="ital">food composed of various ingredients</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mixture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">medley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">olio</hi>, etc. (both significations, however, rest only on the statements of the grammarians); and hence, transf., </sense><sense id="n42726.9" n="A" level="2"> Per saturam, <hi rend="ital">in the gross</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the lump</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">without order</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distinctness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confusedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanx plena diversis frugibus in templum Cereris infertur, quae saturae nomine appellatur, Acro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: satura et cibi genus ex variis rebus conditum et lex multis aliis legibus conferta (this latter signif. has perh. arisen from an erroneous explanation of the foll. expression, per saturam). Itaque in sanctione legum ascribitur: neve per saturam abrogato aut derogato. Ti. Annius Luscus in eā, quam dixit adversus Ti. Gracchum: Imperium, quod plebes per saturam dederat, id abrogatum est. Et C. Laelius in eā, quam pro se dixit ... (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 5</bibl>) Dein postero die quasi per saturam sententiis exquisitis in deditionem accipitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=314" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 314</bibl> Müll.: satira dicta a saturā lance, quae referta variis multisque primitiis in sacro apud priscos diis inferebatur ... sive a quodam genere farciminis, quod multis rebus refertum, saturam dicit Varro vocitatum. Est autem hoc positum in II. libro Plautinarum Quaestionum: Satura est uva passa et polenta et nuclei pinei mulso conspersi: ad haec alii addunt et de malo Punico grana. Alii autem dictam putant a lege saturā, quae uno rogatu multa simul comprehendat, quod scilicet et satura carmina multa simul et poëmata comprehenduntur: cujus legis Lucilius meminit in primo: Per saturam aedilem factum qui legibus solvat et Sallustius in Jugurtha: Deinde quasi per saturam sententiis<cb n="SATU" />  exquisitis in deditionem accipitur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 483</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc opus legentibus tradebatur non secundum edicti perpetui ordinationem sed passim et quasi per saturam collectum et utile cum inutilibus mixtum, Just. praef. Dig. ad Antecess. § 1: Pescennius Festus in libris historiarum per saturam refert, Carthaginienses, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42726.10" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭra</orth>, and after the class. per. <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătĭra</orth> (erroneously <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătyra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a satire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a species of poetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originally dramatic and afterwards didactic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peculiar to the Romans</hi> (not connected with the Greek Satyri); it first received a regular poetic form from Ennius, and after him was cultivated by Lucilius, Horace, Persius, and Juvenal; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quibus in saturā videar nimis acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:103" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 6, 3</bibl>.—Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">Satura jocabunda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 576</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
satura: <entryFree id="n42727" type="main" key="sa^tu^ra" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. satur <sense id="n42727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
saturae: <entryFree id="n42728" type="main" key="Sa^tu^rae" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătŭrae pălūs</orth>, <sense id="n42728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake in Latium</hi>, otherwise unknown; perh. <hi rend="ital">a part of the Pontine Marshes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 801</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:382" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 382</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saturabilis: <entryFree id="n42729" type="gloss" key="sa^tu^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭrābĭlis</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">xortastiko/s,</foreign> Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
saturamen: <entryFree id="n42730" type="main" key="sa^tu^ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>saturo</etym>, <sense id="n42730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a filling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfying</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">inopum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 27, 194</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saturanter: <entryFree id="n42731" type="main" key="sa^tu^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sufficiently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to satiety</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Virg. Cont. p. 149</bibl> Munk.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saturantius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Pathol. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
saturatim: <entryFree id="n42732" type="gloss" key="sa^tu^ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭrātim</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">katako/rws,</foreign> Gloss. Gr. Lat.</entryFree>
saturatio: <entryFree id="n42733" type="hapax" key="sa^tu^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saturo</etym>, a <sense id="n42733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joann. 24" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joann. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saturator: <entryFree id="n42734" type="hapax" key="sa^tu^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a filler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 120:25" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 120, 25</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
saturatus: <entryFree id="n42735" type="main" key="sa^tu^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of saturo.</entryFree>
satureia: <entryFree id="n42736" type="main" key="sa^tu^re_ia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭrēia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n42736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form in <number>plur.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭrēia</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quadrisyl.</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 415</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:75:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 75, 4</bibl>; though this is perh. another plant), <hi rend="ital">the common name for the pot-herb</hi> cunila, <hi rend="ital">savory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:6" default="NO">9, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:10" default="NO">9, 10</bibl> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), 233; 11, 3, 57; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 50, § 165</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satureianus: <entryFree id="n42737" type="main" key="Sa^tu^re_ia_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătŭrēiānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n42737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the appellation of a region in Appulia;</hi> hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Appulian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caballus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 59</bibl></cit> (Schol. Porphyr.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 197</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 335</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satureium: <entryFree id="n42738" type="main" key="sa^tu^re_ium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭrēium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. satureia <sense id="n42738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
saturio: <entryFree id="n42739" type="main" key="Sa^tu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>satur</etym>. <sense id="n42739.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a lost comedy of Plautus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42739.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a parasite in the Persa of Plautus;</hi> hence, in a lusus verbb.: <cit><quote lang="la">Essurio venio, non advenio saturio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saturitas: <entryFree id="n42740" type="main" key="sa^tu^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repletion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satiety</hi> (mostly ante-class. and postAug. for the class. satietas; perh. only once in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n42740.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperitur ostium, unde saturitate saepe ego exii ebrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 45" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid causae est quin virgis te usque ad saturitatem sauciem?</quote> <trans><tr>till you have enough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 53</bibl></cit> (for which usu. ad satietatem; v. satietas); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 16, 3</bibl>.— Humorously personified as <hi rend="ital">the goddess of a parasite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42740.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n42740.3" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to satur, I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">A fulness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">depth</hi> of color, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 39, 64, § 138</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42740.4" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to satur, I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">Fulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plenty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi>: saturitas copiaque rerum omnium quae ad victum hominum pertinent, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 3, 10</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n42740.5" n="C" level="2"> Concr. (superfluity of food which has been eaten, i. e.), <hi rend="ital">excrements</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 92</bibl> (cf. satietas, I. A. 2.).</sense></entryFree>
saturnalia: <entryFree id="n42741" type="main" key="Sa_turna_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnālĭa</orth>, ĭum; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnālĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnālis</orth>, e; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sā-turnĭa</orth>, ae; v. Saturnus.</entryFree>
saturnigena: <entryFree id="n42742" type="main" key="Sa_turni^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Saturnus-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n42742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">offspring of Saturn</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.); of <hi rend="ital">Jupiter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 15, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saturninus: <entryFree id="n42743" type="main" key="Sa_turni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> So esp. L. Appuleius Saturninus, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi> A.U.C. 654; <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with</hi> C. Servilius Glaucia, <hi rend="ital">was pronounced guilty of treason and put to death</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:224" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:11:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saturnius: <entryFree id="n42744" type="main" key="Sa_turni^us" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um.—<sense id="n42744.0" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sātur-nĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. Saturnus, A. <cb n="SATU" /></sense></entryFree>
saturnus: <entryFree id="n42745" type="main" key="Sa_turnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnus</orth> (old collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāteur-nus</orth>, Fest. pp. 323 and 325 Müll., and SAETVRNVS, on a vase; v. Ritschl, de Fictil. Litteratis, and Schweizer, Zeitschr. für vergl. Sprachf. 4, p. 65 sq.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. sero; <cit><quote lang="la">ab satu est dictus Saturnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 64</bibl></cit> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n42745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Saturn; according to the myth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the most ancient king of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who came to Italy in the reign of Janus; afterwards honored as the god of agriculture and of civilization in general;</hi> hence early identified with the <foreign lang="greek">*kro/nos</foreign> of the Greeks: <cit><quote lang="la">qui terram colerent, eos solos reliquos esse ex stirpe Saturni regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes (dei) in Latio Saturnus et Ops,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 57</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">primus ab aetherio venit Saturnus Olympo, Arma Jovis fugiens et regnis exsul ademptis. Is genus indocile ac dispersum montibus altis Composuit legesque dedit Latiumque vocari Maluit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:319 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 319 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:193" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 193</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 235</bibl> sq.; 6, 29 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:9" default="NO">2, 5, 9</bibl> et saep.—As <hi rend="ital">the god of time</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:25:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 25, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 12, 9</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">the sun-god</hi> of the Phœnicians, = Baal, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturni sacra dies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Saturday</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturni Stella,</quote> <trans><tr>the planet Saturn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 46, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the planet Saturn</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 23</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42745.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Saturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Saturnian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the planet Saturn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: mons, <hi rend="ital">an ancient name of the Capitoline Hill</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 42</bibl> Müll., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=322" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 322</bibl> ib.: terra, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Latium</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 42</bibl> ib. (Ann. v. 25 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:625" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 625</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 329</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 569</bibl></cit>; in a wider sense: tellus, for <hi rend="ital">Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 173</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the golden age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: proles, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Picus</hi>, a son of Saturn, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 320</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Italians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:237" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 237</bibl></cit>: Juno, as daughter of Saturn, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 576</bibl> (Ann. v. 65 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 447</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:242" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 242</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also pater (sc. Superum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 372</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 163</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domitor maris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Neptune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:799" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 799</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Vesta</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:383" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 383</bibl></cit>: versus, <hi rend="ital">the Saturnian verse</hi>, the oldest kind of metre among the Romans, in use down to the time of Ennius, Fest. s. v. Saturnus, p. 325 Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the same, numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2439" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 512</bibl></cit>; v. Herm. Doctr. Metr. III. 9, and Bernhardy, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> p. 70 sq.— </sense><sense id="n42745.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42745.3" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n42745.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Jupiter</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1113</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 444 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 703</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Gigant. 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42745.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pluto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 420</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42745.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sātur-nĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the old town of Saturnia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Capitoline Hill</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=325" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 325</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n42745.7" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n42745.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Juno</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1103</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 483 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:265" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 265</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 191</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 612</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n42745.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The town built by Saturn on the Capitoline Hill</hi>, the fabled beginning of Rome, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 42</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 358</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=322" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 322</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n42745.10" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Saturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Saturnian;</hi> as an <pos>adj.</pos> only with festum, = Saturnalia.—</sense><sense id="n42745.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnālĭa</orth>, <itype>iōrum, ibus</itype> (cf. on the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum est licito et Saturnalium et Saturnaliorum dici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; Ruddim. 1, p. 97; v. also Bacchanalia, Compitalia, Vinalia, and the like), <hi rend="ital">a general festival in honor of Saturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beginning on the</hi> 17<hi rend="ital">th of December and lasting several days; the Saturnalia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:21 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 21 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 22</bibl> Müll.; Fest. s. v. ferias, p. 86 ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 64</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 5</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">prima,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the first day of the Saturnalia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 36</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secunda, tertia,</quote> <trans><tr>the second</tr>, <tr>third day of the Saturnalia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 52, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra Saturnalia, said of the feriae matronales, as the festival of the women,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:84:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 84, 11</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: non semper Saturnalia erunt,</quote> <trans><tr>every day cannot be a holiday</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 12:section=2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 12, § 2</bibl></cit>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n42745.12" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnālĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Saturnalia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Saturnalian</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tributum,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>a presen given on the Saturnalia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:17:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:30:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 30, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:91:2" default="NO">7, 91, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:19:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 19, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42745.13" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāturnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Saturn</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. c. Faust. 20, 13. <pb n="1636" /> <cb n="SATY" /></sense></entryFree>
saturo: <entryFree id="n42746" type="main" key="sa^tu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>satur</etym>, <sense id="n42746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satiate</hi> (rare but class.; syn. satio). </sense><sense id="n42746.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia duce naturā mammas appetunt earumque ubertate saturantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec cytiso saturantur apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caede leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 541</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 16, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saturabat glebula talis Patrem ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:166" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to satisfy</tr>, <tr>appease</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Phoen. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 14, 29</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n42746.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish abundantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saturate</hi> with a thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">nec saturare fimo pingui pudeat sola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novalia stercore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">betam multo stercore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunia terrae fimo, Col. poët. 10, 82: culta aquis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to water</tr>, <tr>irrigate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: pallam Tyrio murice, <hi rend="ital">to saturate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dye</hi> or <hi rend="ital">color richly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:48:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 48, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 208</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum multo amomo,</quote> <trans><tr>to anoint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:82" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas pice,</quote> <trans><tr>to smear</tr>, <tr>cover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus murium querno cinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrea,</quote> <trans><tr>to fill</tr>, <tr>stuff</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:Aetn. 266" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> Aetn. 266</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42746.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42746.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">content</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens erecta saturataque bonarum cogitationum epulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines saturati honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eorum agris atque urbibus expleti atque saturati cum hoc cumulo quaestus decederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:42:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 42, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saturavi perfidiam et scelus proditorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 17, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 220</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saturavit se sanguine civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to satisfy</tr>, <tr>sate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—In a Gr. construction: Juno necdum antiquum saturata dolorem, <hi rend="ital">not yet satisfied</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assuaged</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 608</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n42746.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., subject. (for the usu. satio), <hi rend="ital">to cause to loathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make weary of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disgusted with</hi> a thing: hae res vitae me saturant, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 18</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sătŭ-rātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B.); of color, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color saturatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 22, § 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
satus: <entryFree id="n42747" type="main" key="sa^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of 1. sero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42748" type="main" key="sa^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. sero</etym>, <sense id="n42748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">planting</hi> (several times in Cic.; elsewhere rare). </sense><sense id="n42748.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">satui semen dederit nemini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbam asperam, credo (sc. exstitisse), avium congestu, non humano satu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 32, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo vitium ortus, satus, incrementa commemorem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42748.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a begetting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producing; origin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">race</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a primo satu, quo a procreatoribus nati diliguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genitalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1229</bibl></cit>: me ut credam ex tuo esse conceptum satu, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 174, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 174, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculi Jovis satu edito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hominum pecudumve conceptu et satu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caeli satu Terraeque conceptu generati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 11</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42748.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">seed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia praeparat animos ad satus accipiendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
satyriasis: <entryFree id="n42749" type="greek" key="sa^ty^ri^a^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătyrĭăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">saturi/asis,</foreign> <sense id="n42749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">excessive sexual excitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lascivious madness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">priapism</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satyricus: <entryFree id="n42750" type="greek" key="sa^ty^ri^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătyrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">saturiko/s.</foreign> <sense id="n42750.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Satyrs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like Satyrs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>misshapen figures resembling Satyrs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4</bibl></cit>. 19, § 50.—</sense><sense id="n42750.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> (Greek) <hi rend="ital">satire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satiric</hi> (cf. satiricus, with which the word is often confounded): <cit><quote lang="la">genus scenarum (with tragicum and comicum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42750.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">heating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exciting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42751" type="main" key="sa^ty^ri^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătyrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n42751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> (Roman) <hi rend="ital">satire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satiric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satirical;</hi> v. satiricus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
satyrion: <entryFree id="n42752" type="greek" key="sa^ty^ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătyrĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sătyrĭos</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 62, § 96</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">satu/rion,</foreign> <sense id="n42752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant that excited lust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ragwort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satyrion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 63</bibl>, §§ 97, 99; <cit><quote lang="la">also,</quote> <trans><tr>a drink prepared from it</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satyriscus: <entryFree id="n42753" type="greek" key="Sa^ty^riscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sătyriscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, = <foreign lang="greek">*saturi/skos,</foreign> <sense id="n42753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little Satyr</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
satyrographus: <entryFree id="n42754" type="main" key="sa^ty^rogra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătyrogrăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. satirographus.</entryFree>
satyrus: <entryFree id="n42755" type="greek" key="sa^ty^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sătyrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sa/turos.</foreign> <sense id="n42755.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of ape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 8, 8, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:199" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 72, 93, § 199</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42755.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Satyr</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the satyri</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of wood-deities resembling apes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with two goat</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and very lascivious; sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 383</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3</bibl>, <cb n="SAUC" /> 103.—Commonly <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">capripedes Satyros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 580</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:221 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 221 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:397" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 397</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 193</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 692</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:43 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 43 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42755.2" n="B" level="2"> Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*sa/turoi,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">Greek satiric plays</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satyrorum scriptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satyri dicaces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protervi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 233</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saucaptis: <entryFree id="n42756" type="main" key="saucaptis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saucaptis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fictitious spice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 43</bibl> Ritschl (al. sancaptis).</sense></entryFree>
sauciatio: <entryFree id="n42757" type="hapax" key="sauci^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saucĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saucio</etym>, <sense id="n42757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wounding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 15, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saucietas: <entryFree id="n42758" type="hapax" key="sauci^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saucĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saucius</etym>, <sense id="n42758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hurting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saucio: <entryFree id="n42759" type="main" key="sauci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saucĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42759.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class. but rare; not in Cæs.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: vulnero, laedo): Rubrius in turbā sauciatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 5, 13</bibl>: ut ictu tragulae sauciaretur, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 398, 8</bibl> (Hist. 2, 19 Dietsch): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem virgis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungue genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 708</bibl></cit>: radices, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 198</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive quis sauciatus in opere noxam ceperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42759.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., pregn., <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus discipulus valde amat illum, quem Brutus noster sauciavit,</quote> <trans><tr>has stabbed</tr>, <tr>mortally wounded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 22, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42759.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to saucius, II. B. 2.), of the cultivation of the soil, <hi rend="ital">to dig into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear up</hi> the ground: <cit><quote lang="la">sauciet ut duram vomer aduncus humum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae summam partem levi vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. the words vulnero, vulnus, cicatrix, etc.—</sense><sense id="n42759.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To prune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucianda ferro est atque exulceranda vitis in eā parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obliquam vitem plerumque sauciat et interdum praecidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42759.5" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">se</hi> (cf. vulg. Engl., <hi rend="ital">to get shot</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to get drunk</hi>: haec anus admodum friguttit nimirum sauciavit se flore Liberi, Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 562, 25</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">percutio, in the same sense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42759.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (anteand post-class.; rare), <hi rend="ital">to wound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aculeata sunt, facta et famam sauciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cor odio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc modo sauciabatur salus hostium nesciorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 205, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saucius: <entryFree id="n42760" type="main" key="sauci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saucĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n42760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42760.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: omnes saucios Convisit, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 398, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis civibus sauciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 398:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 398, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmus ex acie efferri saepe saucios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 38</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, in milit. lang.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 78 al.</bibl>; cf. humorously: saucius factus sum in Veneris proelio: Sagittā Cupido cor meum transfixit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funesto saucia morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia direptā saucia fecit acu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravissimis vulneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 14, 15</bibl></cit>.—In a Greek construction: <cit><quote lang="la">Haemon Corruit ipse suo saucius ense latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 22</bibl></cit> (2, 8, b, 6); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stat saucia pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 49</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">In the time of Quintilian freq. in prose: jam vulgatum actis quoque saucius pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42760.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">smitten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enfeebled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distempered</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n42760.3" n="1" level="3"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatori illi confecto et saucio consules imperatoresque vestros opponite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 24</bibl></cit>.—Of sick persons: <cit><quote lang="la">fato saucia (for which previously, affecta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit> (3, 24), 31; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier diutino situ viscerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 318, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also infra, 2.—Of hungry persons: Belua male saucia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:789" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 789</bibl></cit>.—Of intoxicated persons: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicat, nescit saucia Terpsichore,</quote> <trans><tr>giddy</tr>, <tr>reeling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:68:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 68, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli hesterno mero saucii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:8:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucios per noctem opprimit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 195, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42760.4" n="2" level="3"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">(tellus) rastro intacta nec ullis Saucia vomeribus,</quote> <trans><tr>wounded</tr>, <tr>torn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">securi Saucia trabs ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:373" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 373</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(janua) nocturnis potorum saucia rixis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus celeri saucius Africo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glacies incerto saucia sole,</quote> <trans><tr>weakened</tr>, <tr>melted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 808</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus lubrico fluxu saucia,</quote> <trans><tr>attacked</tr>, <tr>diseased</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 144, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">supra, 1.: incaluit quoties saucia vena mero,</quote> <trans><tr>excited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:66:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 66, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. supra, 1. —</sense><sense id="n42760.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smitten</hi> by love (so most freq., as in all languages); cf. supra, I., the passage from Plautus: Medea animo aegra, amore saevo saucia, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 8, 18</bibl> (Trag. v. 288 Vahl.; a transl. of <foreign lang="greek">*)/erwti qumo\n e)kplagei=sa,</foreign> Eurip. Med. prol. <cb n="SAXI" /> 8): <cit><quote lang="la">regina gravi jamdudum saucia curā, Vulnus alit venis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1044" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1044</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir Pieriā pellice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse a nostro igne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo tua saucia mater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:109" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42760.6" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">wounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injured</hi> in any way: <cit><quote lang="la">subesse nescio quid opinionis incommodae sauciumque ejus animum insedisse quasdam odiosas suspiciones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juno saucia dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:248" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucius dolore multo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 9, 90</bibl></cit>: Servilius de repetundis saucius, <hi rend="ital">injured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sullied</hi> in character, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42760.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Post-class. with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Psyche aegra corporis, animi saucia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatigationis hesternae saucius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 121: <cit><quote lang="la">clientes famae et salutis saucii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 5, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saufeius: <entryFree id="n42761" type="main" key="Saufe_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saufēius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Saufēia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n42761.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Saufeius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42761.2" n="2" level="3"> L. Saufeius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saul: <entryFree id="n42762" type="main" key="Sa^u_l"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Săūl</orth>, <itype>ūlis</itype>, or <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first king of the Jews</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> ad Sor. 435</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 13, 601</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 13, 21</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Saulis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 10, 29</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> Sauli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 51, 1</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Saulem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 15, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saulus: <entryFree id="n42763" type="main" key="Saulus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saulus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Saul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of St. Paul before his conversion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ench. 186</bibl>; Arat. A. Ap. 1, 709; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 9, 1</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
saumarius: <entryFree id="n42764" type="main" key="sauma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saumārĭus</orth>, a late form for <orth extent="full" lang="la">sagmā-rĭus</orth>, Ven. Fort. v. Germ. 3.</entryFree>
saurea: <entryFree id="n42765" type="main" key="Saurea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saurea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saurion: <entryFree id="n42766" type="greek" key="sauri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saurĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sau/rion,</foreign> <sense id="n42766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mustard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 54, § 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sauritis: <entryFree id="n42767" type="greek" key="sauri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saurītis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sauri=tis</foreign> (lizardstone), <sense id="n42767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 67, § 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saurix: <entryFree id="n42768" type="gloss" key="saurix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saurix</orth>, v. sorix.</entryFree>
sauroctonos: <entryFree id="n42769" type="greek" key="Sau_rocto^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saūroctŏnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*saurokto/nos,</foreign> <sense id="n42769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lizard-killer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Apollo;</hi> hence, Apollo Sauroctonos, <hi rend="ital">a statue by Praxiteles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 70</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:172" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 172</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sauromatae: <entryFree id="n42770" type="main" key="Sauro^ma^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saurŏmătae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Saurŏ-mătes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Sarmatae.</entryFree>
sauromatis: <entryFree id="n42771" type="main" key="Sauro^ma^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saurŏmătis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Sarmatae, C.</entryFree>
savillum: <entryFree id="n42772" type="main" key="savillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">savillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suavis</etym>, <sense id="n42772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cheese-cake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
savio: <entryFree id="n42773" type="main" key="sa_vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sāvĭo, sāvĭŏlum, sāvĭor, sāvĭ-um</orth>, v. suav-.</entryFree>
savus: <entryFree id="n42774" type="main" key="Sa_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sāvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Saus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*saou=os,</foreign> <sense id="n42774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Pannonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tributary of the Danube</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Save</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 192</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 3, 8</bibl>; Sex. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Form Saus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 147</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sā-vensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">lying upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adjoining the Save</hi>: regis, Sex. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
