saxa: <entryFree id="n42775" type="main" key="Saxa" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saxa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of</hi> L. Decidius, <hi rend="ital">a partisan of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 8, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saxarubra: <entryFree id="n42776" type="main" key="Saxa Rubra" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saxa Rubra</orth>, <sense id="n42776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a place</hi>, v. ruber, II. B.</sense></entryFree>
saxatilis: <entryFree id="n42777" type="main" key="saxa_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saxum</etym>, <sense id="n42777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that dwells</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is found among rocks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saxatile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>which inhabit towers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <trans><tr>that frequent rocks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatus (opp. hamatilis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">saxātĭles</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fishes that frequent rocks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 20, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:94" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 31, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:109" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
saxetanus: <entryFree id="n42778" type="main" key="saxe_ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxētānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sexitanus.</entryFree>
saxetum: <entryFree id="n42779" type="main" key="saxe_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>saxum</etym>, <sense id="n42779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rocky place</hi> (very rare): asperum saxetum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 25, 67</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 9</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. saxosa).</sense></entryFree>
saxeus: <entryFree id="n42780" type="main" key="saxe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n42780.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of rock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rocky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stony</hi>: saxea est verruca in summo montis vertice, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 48</bibl>: moles, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 283</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 699</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strata viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:984" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 984</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crepido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigies bacchantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra,</quote> <trans><tr>of the rocks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 145</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mater ad auditas stupuit ceu saxea voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 509</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Niobe saxea facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:181" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse Anien, infraque superque Saxeus,</quote> <trans><tr>rocky in its shores and bed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:20" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42780.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">as hard as stone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes (asini),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 249, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durities jecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:6:81" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 6, 81</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n42780.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">stony</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfeeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obdurate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxeus ferreusque es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saxialis: <entryFree id="n42781" type="main" key="saxi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of rock</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stone</hi>, <pb n="1637" /> <cb n="SAXU" /> <hi rend="ital">stone-</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">termini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 132" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 132</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
saxifer: <entryFree id="n42782" type="hapax" key="saxi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saxum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n42782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stone-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that hurl stones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:608" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 608</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saxificus: <entryFree id="n42783" type="main" key="saxi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saxum-facio</etym>, <sense id="n42783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that turns into stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">petrifying</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Medusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:555" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 555</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:178" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 670</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus Medusae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os (Medusae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 901" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 901</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saxifragus: <entryFree id="n42784" type="main" key="saxi^fra^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxĭfrăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saxum-frango</etym>, <sense id="n42784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stone-breaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stone-crushing</hi>: undae maris, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 167</bibl> (Ann. v. 564 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">adiantum, so called because it breaks or dissolves the stone in the bladder,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 30, § 64</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 32, 602</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 67</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (sc. herba), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 11, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
saxigenus: <entryFree id="n42785" type="hapax" key="saxi^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saxum-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n42785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sprung from stone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saxiperium: <entryFree id="n42786" type="main" key="saxi^pe_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxĭpērĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>saxum-pero</etym>, <sense id="n42786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bag to hold stones for slinging</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Serm. 74</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 17, 40</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
saxitas: <entryFree id="n42787" type="main" key="saxi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saxum</etym>, <sense id="n42787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stony nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stoniness</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:8" default="NO">3, 8</bibl>, n. 109; cf. saxositas.</sense></entryFree>
saxo: <entryFree id="n42788" type="main" key="Saxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Saxo</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Saxon; acc.</hi> Saxona, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 255</bibl>; id. Epith. Pallad. et Cel. 89; <case>abl.</case> Saxone, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 31</bibl>; id. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 219; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Eutr. 1, 392</bibl>.—Usu. <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Saxŏnes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the Saxons</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 8, 5</bibl>; Salv. Gub. Dei, 7, 15; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 21</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Saxŏnia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Saxons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Saxony</hi>, Ven. Fort. 7, 16, 47.</sense></entryFree>
saxositas: <entryFree id="n42789" type="hapax" key="saxo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>saxosus</etym>, <sense id="n42789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stony nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stoniness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:6:82" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 6, 82</bibl>; cf. saxitas.</sense></entryFree>
saxosus: <entryFree id="n42790" type="main" key="saxo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxōsus</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">saxŭōsus</orth>, Sicul. Fl. p. 11 Goes.), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>saxum</etym>, <sense id="n42790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of rocks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rocky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 21:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 8:16:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hypanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphrates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 20, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frutex,</quote> <trans><tr>growing among stones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phlegethon saxosa incendia torquet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:565" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 565</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">saxōsa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">rocky</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stony places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscium genera alia planis gaudent, alia saxosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 21</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saxatiles pisces, under saxatilis): herba in saxosis nascens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 29, 103, § 175</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saxulum: <entryFree id="n42791" type="hapax" key="saxu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little rock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in asperrimis saxulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saxum: <entryFree id="n42792" type="main" key="saxum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxum</orth> (in inscrr. also SAKSVM; from collat. form saxus; <sense id="n42792.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">a vocative SAXE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2982</bibl></cit>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root sak-; Sanscr. ska; cf. secare</etym>, <hi rend="ital">any large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough stone; a detached fragment of rock; a rock</hi> (in gen.; whereas rupes is a steep rock, crag, cliff). </sense><sense id="n42792.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:266 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 266 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:882" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 882</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est e saxo sculptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 100</bibl></cit>: pars ludicre saxa Jactant, inter se licitantur, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 134, 13</bibl> (Ann. v. 76 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Sisyphum) adverso nixantem trudere monte Saxum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1001" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1001</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miser impendens magnum timet aëre saxum Tantalus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:980" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 980</bibl></cit>: saxo cere comminuit brum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 412</bibl> (Ann. v. 586 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si glebis aut saxis aut fustibus aliquem de fundo praecipitem egeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin.21,60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni ponderis saxa, in muro collocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 7, 23; 7, 46: (Thyestes) summis saxis fixus asperis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl> (Trag. v. 413 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicite religatum asperis Vinctumque saxis (Prometheum), Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 23: speluncas saxis pendentibu' structas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 195</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of the cave of Cacus: jam primum saxis suspensam hanc aspice rupem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot congesta manu praeruptis oppida saxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter saxa rupesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40</bibl></cit>: saxa spargens tabo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl> (Trag. v. 414 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">vesco sale saxa peresa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec turbida ponti Aequora fligebant naves ad saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1001" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1001</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad saxum quo capessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 89</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis non saxum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 49, § 169</bibl></cit>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">in saxis silicibus uberiores aquae sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>in limestone rocks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42792.2" n="2" level="3"> Prov. </sense><sense id="n42792.3" n="a" level="4"> Saxum volvere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to strive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">endeavor in vain</hi> (alluding to the stone of Sisyphus): <cit><quote lang="la">satis diu hoc jam saxum volvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42792.4" n="b" level="4"> Inter sacrum saxumque stare; v. sacrum, A. 2. b.—</sense><sense id="n42792.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n42792.6" n="A" level="2"> For Saxum Tarpejum (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=343" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 343</bibl> Müll. and <cb n="SCAB" /> v. Tarpejus, II.), <hi rend="ital">the Tarpeian Rock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horribilis de saxo jactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1016" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1016</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 25</bibl>; v. Tarpeius.—</sense><sense id="n42792.7" n="B" level="2"> Saxum sacrum, <hi rend="ital">the sacred rock on the Aventine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at which Remus consulted the auspices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:53:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 53, 136</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called saxum alone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:150" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42792.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A superior kind of Cimolian chalk</hi> (creta Cimolia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 196</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42792.9" n="D" level="2"> Saxa Rubra; v. ruber, II. B.—</sense><sense id="n42792.10" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42792.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: saxa, <hi rend="ital">stony ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rocky places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis in apricis coquitur vindemia saxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:522" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ligurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:22" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42792.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A stone wall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus saxo lucum circumdedit alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:431" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 431</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42792.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The strong foundation of a building</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolium quadrato saxo substructum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
saxuosus: <entryFree id="n42793" type="main" key="saxu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">saxŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. saxosus <sense id="n42793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scabellum: <entryFree id="n42794" type="main" key="sca^bellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăbellum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scăbillum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scamnum; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 12</bibl></etym>. <sense id="n42794.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A low stool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">footstool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cricket</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:35:46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 35, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:98:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 98, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:66:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 66, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42794.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an instrument of the nature of the castanet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">played on by the foot</hi>, esp. used in dramatic representations, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 27, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mus. 3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mus. 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
scaber: <entryFree id="n42795" type="main" key="sca^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăber</orth>, <itype>bra, brum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n42795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scurfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scabrous</hi> (esp. from uncleanness). </sense><sense id="n42795.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42795.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): pectus illuvie scabrum, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:921" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 921</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubigine dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 802</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabros nigrae morsu rubiginis enses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 243</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 276</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaber intonsusque homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tophus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 214</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">robigo (pilorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 495</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scabies et robigo ferri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 220</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">cortex (opp. levis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 55, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia (opp. levia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:130" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 9, 46, § 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 114</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor myrrhae junipero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 15, 34, § 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42795.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">scabby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mangy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">itchy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 96, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 8, 2</bibl> Mai: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 87, § 239</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42795.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, etc. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">versus (sc. veterum poëtarum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
scabidus: <entryFree id="n42796" type="main" key="sca^bi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăbĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scabies</etym>, <sense id="n42796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scabby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mangy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">itchy</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n42796.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">palpebrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42796.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">concupiscentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scabies: <entryFree id="n42797" type="main" key="sca^bi^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăbĭes</orth>, <itype>em, ē</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scabo</etym>, <sense id="n42797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a roughness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scurf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42797.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42797.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ferri (with robigo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 220</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scabra robigo pilorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 495</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:153" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetusta cariosae testae,</quote> <trans><tr>filth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 220, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42797.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., as a disease, <hi rend="ital">the scab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">itch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 16</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 160, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:31:2" default="NO">6, 31, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:5" default="NO">7, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 441</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:34" default="NO">8, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 453</bibl> et saep.—Of plants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 225</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:176" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 10, 57, § 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:33" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 3, 21, § 33</bibl>.—Scabies, <hi rend="ital">the itch</hi>, personified and worshipped as <hi rend="ital">a divinity</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 220</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42797.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">an itching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">longing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pruriency</hi> (very rare): cujus (voluptatis) blanditiis corrupti, quae naturā bona sunt, quia dulcedine hac et scabie carent, non cernunt satis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 17, 47</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">scabies et contagia lucri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos hac a scabie (sc. rodendi, detrectandi) tenemus ungues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:60:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 60, 11</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">lust</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:37:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 37, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:7:6" default="NO">11, 7, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scabillarii: <entryFree id="n42798" type="gloss" key="sca^billa_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăbillārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scabillum</etym>, <sense id="n42798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">players on the</hi> scabellum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2643</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scabillum: <entryFree id="n42799" type="main" key="sca^billum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăbillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. scabellum.</entryFree>
scabiola: <entryFree id="n42800" type="hapax" key="sca^bi^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăbĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scabies</etym>, <sense id="n42800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the scab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the itch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:adv. Julian. 4:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> adv. Julian. 4, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scabiosus: <entryFree id="n42801" type="main" key="sca^bi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăbĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n42801.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scurfy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coralium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 11, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">far,</quote> <trans><tr>old</tr>, <tr>spoiled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:74" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42801.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Scabby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mangy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves, Col.11,2,83: (homo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguli (oculorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 10, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macies mulorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 223</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scabitudo: <entryFree id="n42802" type="hapax" key="sca^bi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăbĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> [scabies, II.), <sense id="n42802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an itching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritation.</hi>—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of anger: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem scabitudinem animi delere, sine cicatrice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 99, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scabo: <entryFree id="n42803" type="main" key="sca^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăbo</orth>, <itype>scābi</itype> (no <sense id="n42803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root skap-, skamp; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ska/ptw,</foreign> to dig; <foreign lang="greek">ka/petos,</foreign> ditch; Lat. scaber, scabies</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to scratch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to scrape</hi> (syn. rado): caput, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 472, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 71</bibl>: scaberat ut porcus contritis<cb n="SCAE" />  arbore costis, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 884</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">aures pedibus posterioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 48, 108, § 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:204" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 74, 95, § 204</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 71, 91, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laminas (doliorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 26, 64, § 236</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuum scabere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to praise one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:31" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Ep. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scabratus: <entryFree id="n42804" type="hapax" key="sca^_bra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scă_brātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scaber</etym>, <sense id="n42804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roughened</hi>: vitis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">jagged</hi> by pruning it with a dull knife, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scabredo: <entryFree id="n42805" type="main" key="sca^_bre_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scă_brēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scaber, I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n42805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a roughness of the skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scabbiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">itch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mange</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 73</bibl>; Coripp. 4, 48; Hier. Vit. Hil. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scabreo: <entryFree id="n42806" type="main" key="sca^_bre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scă_brĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>scabo</etym>, <sense id="n42806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be scurfy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scabby</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 169, 21</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 23 Rib.; Vahl. ad Enn. l. l. p. 106, reads scaprent); Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 152, 29</bibl> (l. l. p. 97 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
scabres: <entryFree id="n42807" type="hapax" key="sca^_bres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scă_bres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the scab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the itch</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 168, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scabridus: <entryFree id="n42808" type="hapax" key="sca^_bri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scă_brĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scaber</etym>, <sense id="n42808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugged</hi>: lingua robigine, Ven. Carm. 2, 13, 7.</sense></entryFree>
scabritia: <entryFree id="n42809" type="main" key="sca^_bri^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scă_brĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">scă_brĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>em, ē</itype> (in both forms post-Aug.; esp. freq. in Plin.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n42809.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">roughness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruggedness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 34, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae levigatur dente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 25, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 41, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arteriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 105, § 130</bibl></cit> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n42809.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The scab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the itch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scabrosus: <entryFree id="n42810" type="main" key="sca^_bro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scă_brōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scabrous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scaeaporta: <entryFree id="n42811" type="main" key="Scaea porta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scaea porta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*skaiai\ pu/lai,</foreign> <sense id="n42811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Scœan</hi> (western, <foreign lang="greek">skaio/s</foreign>) gate of Troy; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 351</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:73" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 73</bibl>; also, acc. to the Greek, in the <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scaeae portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 612</bibl></cit>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: Scaeae, <hi rend="ital">the Scœan gate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Astyanax Scaeis dejectus ab altis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. Her. 15, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scaena: <entryFree id="n42812" type="main" key="scaena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (falsely <orth extent="full" lang="la">scēna</orth>, v. Prol. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> p. 387</bibl> Rib.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skhnh/.</foreign> <sense id="n42812.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the stage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scene</hi> of a theatre: <cit><quote lang="la">dum histrio in scaenă siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scaenă esse Roscium intellegat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:290" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foris hic extra scaenam fient proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum scaena croco Cilici perfusa recens est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaenaique simul varios splendere decores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:983" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 983</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaenae magnificentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:19:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 19, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero scaena solum referta est his sceleribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel scaena ut versis discedat frontibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 205</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnas excidunt, scaenis decora alta futuris,</quote> <trans><tr>a theatre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 429</bibl></cit>: aut Agamemnonius scaenis agitatus Orestes, <hi rend="ital">on the stage</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in tragedies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 471</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut agitur res in scaenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 179</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42812.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42812.2" n="1" level="3"> Of a place like <hi rend="ital">a scene</hi> of a theatre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 164</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42812.3" n="2" level="3"> (Post-Aug.) Of the schools of rhetoric, as <hi rend="ital">scenes</hi> for the display of eloquence: <cit><quote lang="la">at nunc adulescentuli deducuntur in scaenas scholasticorum, qui rhetores vocantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 35</bibl></cit>; cf. Plin Ep. 7, 17, 9.— </sense><sense id="n42812.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42812.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The public stage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the public</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia maxima quasi oratori scaena videatur contionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 338</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi se a vulgo et scaena in secreta remorant Virtus Scipiadae et mitis sapientia Laeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 71</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: scaenae servire, <hi rend="ital">to show one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">live in the public eye</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 8, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42812.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Outward show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretext</hi>: scaena rei totius haec: Pompeius, tamquam Caesarem non impugnet, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid scaenae deesset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaenam ultro criminis parat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n42812.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaenam quam sponte sumpserat cum animă retinens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, 20, p. 151, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scaenalis: <entryFree id="n42813" type="main" key="scaena_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scaenālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scaena</etym>, <sense id="n42813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the stage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scenic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theatrical</hi> (very rare for scaenicus): <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 77</bibl></cit>: frondes, Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. 2, p. 48 Burm.</sense></entryFree>
scaenarius: <entryFree id="n42814" type="main" key="scaena_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scaenārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the stage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scenic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dramatic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theatrical</hi> (late Lat. for scaenicus): <cit><quote lang="la">artifices,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>players</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PICTOR,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a scenepainter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 948, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scaenaticus: <entryFree id="n42815" type="hapax" key="scaena_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scaenātĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stageplayer</hi>: ut comici, cinaedici, scaenatici, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 176, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scaenatilis: <entryFree id="n42816" type="hapax" key="scaena_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scaenātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, for scenicus, <sense id="n42816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the stage</hi>, Varr. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 176, 18</bibl> (an unintelligible passage). <pb n="1638" /> <cb n="SCAE" /></sense></entryFree>
scaenice: <entryFree id="n42817" type="main" key="scaeni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scaenĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. scaenicus <sense id="n42817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scaenicus: <entryFree id="n42818" type="greek" key="scaeni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scaenĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scen-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">skhniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n42818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the stage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scenic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dramatic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theatrical</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n42818.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae,</quote> <trans><tr>dramatic poets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 17</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">artifices,</quote> <trans><tr>players</tr>, <tr>actors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:4" default="NO">11, 3, 4</bibl>: ludi, <hi rend="ital">stage-plays</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theatrical representations</hi>, in a gen. sense (opp. to games of wrestling, racing, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:54" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 54</bibl>; Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 11</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">operae (with gladiatoriae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula,</quote> <trans><tr>a drama</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">organa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decor quidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicacitas (with scurrilis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna dubia, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 8: adulteria,</quote> <trans><tr>represented on the stage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:514" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 514</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam, quod est inprimis frivolum ac scaenicum, verbum petant (declamatores), quo incipiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil scaenicum apud Graecos pudori est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 24</bibl></cit>; cf., with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">complodere manus scaenicum est et pectus caedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42818.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42818.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">scaē-nĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a player</hi>, <hi rend="ital">actor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator plurimum aberit a scaenico (with comoedi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:79:section=184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 79, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:158" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl> et saep.—As a term of reproach applied to Nero (on account of his passion for the stage), <hi rend="ital">a stage-hero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42818.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">scaenĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female player</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an actress</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 27, 1</bibl>; Ambros. Obit. Valent. § 17.—* </sense><sense id="n42818.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (opp. to real, true, actual), <hi rend="ital">fictitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretended</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Romanus, invictus a veris regibus, ab illo imaginario et scaenico rege (sc. Andrisco) superatur,</quote> <trans><tr>by that theatrical king</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:14:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scaenĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">theatrically</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after the manner of players</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliqua velut scaenice fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scaenographia: <entryFree id="n42819" type="greek" key="scaeno^gra^phi^_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scaenŏgrăphĭ_a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skhnografi/a,</foreign> <sense id="n42819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing in perspective</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaenographia est frontis et laterum abscedentium adumbratio ad circinique centrum omnium linearum responsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit> Rode. (Others read <orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭāgrăphĭ_a</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">skia=grafi/a</foreign>, in the same signif.)</sense></entryFree>
scaeva: <entryFree id="n42820" type="main" key="scaeva1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scaeva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. scaevus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42821" type="main" key="scaeva2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scaeva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scaevus</etym>, <sense id="n42821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lefthanded person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 12</bibl>; cf. Scaevola.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42822" type="main" key="Scaeva3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scaeva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. scaeva</etym>, <sense id="n42822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. D. Junius Brutus Scaeva, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 429, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassius Scaeva,</quote> <trans><tr>a partisan of Cœsar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 23, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scaevitas: <entryFree id="n42823" type="main" key="scaevi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scaevĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scaevus, II.</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n42823.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Awkwardness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perverseness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unskilfulness</hi>, Gell. praef., § 20; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 2, 8: artium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42823.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mischance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 135, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 189, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">indignae rei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 221, 21.</sense></entryFree>
scaevola: <entryFree id="n42824" type="main" key="Scaevo^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scaevŏla</orth> (in the Fast. Capit. also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scaevŭla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prop. a dim. of 3. Scaeva, the Left-handed</etym>. <sense id="n42824.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of</hi> C. Mucius, <hi rend="ital">who made his way into the camp of Porsenna to kill him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on being discovered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burned off his own right hand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 21, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:386 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 386 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42824.1" n="2" level="3"> After his time, <hi rend="ital">a frequent surname in the</hi> gens Mucia; so, P. Mucius Scaevola, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 621, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Tiberius Gracchus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 13</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 285</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 36, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42824.2" n="3" level="3"> Q. Mucius Scaevola, <hi rend="ital">an augur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the most famous jurist of Cicero</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son-inlaw of</hi> C. Laelius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:101 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 26, 101 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">58, 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scaevus: <entryFree id="n42825" type="greek" key="scaevus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scaevus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>kindred with Sanscr. savya, laevus, sinister, as the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skaio/s</foreign> and the Germ. schief, oblique</etym>, <sense id="n42825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is on the left</hi>, <hi rend="ital">towards the left side</hi> (rare; most freq. in Appul.; syn. laevus, sinister). </sense><sense id="n42825.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera portarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>running from right to left</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 351</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42825.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42825.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Awkward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaevus profecto et caecus animi forem, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 223, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaevus iste Romulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 41, 5</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 11, 44</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42825.4" n="B" level="2"> Of fortune, <hi rend="ital">unfavorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untoward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlucky</hi>:<cb n="SCAL" />  fortunam scaevam an saevam verius dixerim, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 120, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesagium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 247; 7, p. 194, 39.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaevissimum somnium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 154, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scaeva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">token in the sky</hi> (observed by a Roman on his left; v. laevus), <hi rend="ital">an omen</hi>: bonae scaevae causă...Ea dicta ab scaevā id est sinistră, quod quae sinistra sunt, bona auspicia existimantur...a Graeco est, quod hi sinistram vocant <foreign lang="greek">skaia/n</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=97" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 97</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=325" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 325</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">bona scaeva est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 39</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canina scaeva,</quote> <trans><tr>taken from the barking of a dog</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scala: <entryFree id="n42826" type="main" key="sca_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scāla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (acc. to the ancient grammarians, not used in <number>sing.</number>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9</bibl>, §§ 63 and 68; 10, § 54 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl> Spald.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 20</bibl> P. p. 72 ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 315</bibl> ib. al.; but <sense id="n42826.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for scandla, from scando; cf. mala, from mando</etym>, mostly <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scālae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a flight of steps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stairs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a staircase; a ladder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scaling-ladder.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42826.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42826.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalas dare alicui utendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: scalarum gradus, <hi rend="ital">the rounds of a ladder</hi>, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 3</bibl>: Romani scalis summă nituntur opum vi, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 168 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalas ponere,</quote> <trans><tr>to fix</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalas admovere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 63</bibl></cit>; 3, 80; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 15, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:9:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 9, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">murum scalis aggredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 57:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 57, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:60:7" default="NO" valid="yes">60, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 507</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 15</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">scalis habito tribus et altis,</quote> <trans><tr>up three flights of stairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:118:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 118, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42826.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic.: Scalae Gemoniae, v. Gemoniae.—* </sense><sense id="n42826.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">steps</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec per ducentas cum domum tulit scalas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:20:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 20, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42826.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n42826.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a ladder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalam commodare ad ascendendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:55" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 55</bibl></cit> (54), § 4; cf. Aquil. Rom. p. 181 Ruhnk.—</sense><sense id="n42826.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n42826.8" n="1" level="3"> Scala gallinaria, <hi rend="ital">a hen-roost</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a crossbar of like form</hi>, used for reducing a dislocated shoulder, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42826.9" n="2" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">Jacob</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s ladder</hi>, seen in his dream, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 28, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 3, § 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">108, § 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scalaria: <entryFree id="n42827" type="main" key="sca_la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scālārĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. scalaris.</entryFree>
scalarii: <entryFree id="n42828" type="gloss" key="sca_la_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scālārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scalae</etym>, <sense id="n42828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stairmakers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4071</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scalaris: <entryFree id="n42829" type="main" key="sca_la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scālāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a flight of steps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a ladder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">STRVCTIO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4570</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scālārĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a flight of stairs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">steps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a staircase</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl>; also in the <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">SCALARE, is,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4750</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scaldis: <entryFree id="n42830" type="main" key="Scaldis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scaldis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Scheldt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a river of Gallia Belgica</hi>; <case>acc.</case> Scaldem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 33</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scaldim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 98</bibl></cit>; <case>abl.</case> Scalde, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:17:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 17, 31</bibl>, or Scaldi, ib.</sense></entryFree>
scalenus: <entryFree id="n42831" type="greek" key="sca^le_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scălēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">skalhno/s;</foreign> in mathematics, of a triangle, <sense id="n42831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of unequal sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scalene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">figura geometrica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 13</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 7.</sense></entryFree>
scalmus: <entryFree id="n42832" type="greek" key="scalmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scalmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skalmo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peg to which an oar was strapped; a thole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tholepin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:53:197" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 53, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:43:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 43, 1</bibl>: venit (Canius) mature: scalmum nullum videt, <hi rend="ital">not even a thole-pin</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">no trace of a boat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scalpellum: <entryFree id="n42833" type="main" key="scalpellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scalpellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">scal-pellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl> twice), <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scalprum</etym>, <sense id="n42833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small surgical knife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scalpel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lancet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalpellum adhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 65, 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:32:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 32, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 28, § 110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:27:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 27, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribae,</quote> <trans><tr>a penknife</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:36:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 36, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scalper: <entryFree id="n42834" type="main" key="scalper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scalper</orth>, <itype>ri</itype>, v. scalprum.</entryFree>
scalpo: <entryFree id="n42835" type="main" key="scalpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scalpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root skalp-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ska/loy,</foreign> mole; Lat. talpa; cf. scalprum; also Gr. <foreign lang="greek">glu/fw</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n42835.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scratch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engrave</hi> (class.; syn. caelo), said of surface work, = <foreign lang="greek">ce/ein;</foreign> sculpo, of deeper work, high relief, or statuary, = <foreign lang="greek">glu/fw</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pingendum, ad fingendum, ad scalpendum apta manus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phidiam tradunt scalpsisse marmora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmora ac scyphos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 128</bibl></cit> (Sillig, sculpsit): <cit><quote lang="la">gemmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 65, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores et acanthi eleganter scalpti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcro querelam,</quote> <trans><tr>to carve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 52</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to scratch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram unguibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to scratch</tr>, <tr>dig</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exulceratam verrucam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 16</bibl></cit>: nates, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 516, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput uno digito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:133" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 133</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SCAM" /> scalpendo tantum ferreis unguibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 7, 14, § 56</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n42835.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in mal. part., <hi rend="ital">to tickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">titillate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremulo scalpuntur ubi intima versu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:21" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scalpratus: <entryFree id="n42836" type="hapax" key="scalpra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scalprātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scalprum</etym>, <sense id="n42836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a sharp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cutting edge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
