scalprum: <entryFree id="n42837" type="main" key="scalprum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scalprum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">scalper</orth>, <itype>ri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3</bibl>) [scalpo], <sense id="n42837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sharp cutting instrument; a chisel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knife</hi>, etc., of sculptors, husbandmen, shoemakers, surgeons, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 65:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 65, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A penknife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a pruning-knife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 16, 26, § 119</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scalptor: <entryFree id="n42838" type="main" key="scalptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scalptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graver</hi> in metal or stone (cf. sculptor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:44" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 6, 5, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:60" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 4, 15, § 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scalptorium: <entryFree id="n42839" type="main" key="scalpto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scalptōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for scratching one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, in the form of a hand, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:83" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 83</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scalptura: <entryFree id="n42840" type="main" key="scalptu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scalptūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n42840.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cutting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carving</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">graving</hi> in stone: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 30, § 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42840.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a graved figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sculpture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zophori scalpturis ornati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scalpturigo: <entryFree id="n42841" type="hapax" key="scalptu^ri_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scalptŭrīgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scalpŭrīgo</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scalpturio</etym>, <sense id="n42841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scratching</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 32 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
scalpturio: <entryFree id="n42842" type="hapax" key="scalptu_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scalptūrĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">scalpūrĭo</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 171, 32</bibl>), īre, <sense id="n42842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desid. n.</hi> [scalpo], <hi rend="ital">to scratch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">claw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occoepit (gallus) ibi scalpturire ungulis circumcirca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scamander: <entryFree id="n42843" type="main" key="Sca^mander"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scămander</orth>, <itype>dri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ska/mandros.</foreign> <sense id="n42843.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Troas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Scamander</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Bunar-bashi Tchai</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 124</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 467, 31</bibl> (Trag. v. 214 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:14 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 14 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 357</bibl>.—Called <hi rend="ital">Xanthus</hi>, from its red color, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 473</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 245</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scămandrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the river Scamander</hi>: unda, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 192, 1</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 322 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n42843.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A freedman of the Fabricii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 74</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scămandrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a town on the Scamander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 33, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scambus: <entryFree id="n42844" type="greek" key="scambus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scambus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">skambo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bow-legged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bandy-legged</hi> (pure Lat. varus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scamellum: <entryFree id="n42845" type="main" key="sca^mellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scămellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. scamillus.</entryFree>
scamillus: <entryFree id="n42846" type="main" key="sca^millus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scămillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 615</bibl> P., <orth extent="full" lang="la">scămellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>) <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scamnum</etym>, <sense id="n42846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bench</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stool</hi>: impares, i. e. <hi rend="ital">unequal projections</hi> or <hi rend="ital">steps</hi> on the pedestals of columns, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> 615</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
scamma: <entryFree id="n42847" type="main" key="scamma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scamma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ska/mma,</foreign> <sense id="n42847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestling-place</hi> in the Palaestra. </sense><sense id="n42847.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Joann. Hieros. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 61, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. 1, 16</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n42847.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a wrestling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Martyr. 3</bibl>; cf. harena. II.</sense></entryFree>
scammonea: <entryFree id="n42848" type="greek" key="scammo_ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scammōnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skammwni/a,</foreign> <sense id="n42848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scammony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 22, § 54</bibl>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">scammōnĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 12</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scammōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 58, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:93" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 9, 60, § 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 140" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 140</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scammōnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 38, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scammoneum: <entryFree id="n42849" type="main" key="scammo_ne^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scammōnĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. scammonea.</entryFree>
scammonia: <entryFree id="n42850" type="main" key="scammo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scammōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. scammonea.</entryFree>
scammonites: <entryFree id="n42851" type="greek" key="scammo_ni_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scammōnītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skammwni/ths</foreign> (SC. <foreign lang="greek">oi)=nos</foreign>), <sense id="n42851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine seasoned with scammony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scammonium: <entryFree id="n42852" type="main" key="scammo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scammōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. scammonea.</entryFree>
scamnatus: <entryFree id="n42853" type="main" key="scamna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scamnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scamnum, II. B.</etym>; in the agrimensores: ager, <sense id="n42853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a field whose breadth</hi> (or measurement from east to west) <hi rend="ital">is greater than its length</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aggen.</author> p. 46</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
scamnum: <entryFree id="n42854" type="main" key="scamnum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scamnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for scap-num; root skap-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skh/ptw</foreign>, to support; cf.: scabellum, scapus, scipio</etym>, <sense id="n42854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">step</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n42854.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: quă simplici scansione scandebant in lectum non altum, scabellum; <cit><quote lang="la">in altiorem, scamnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=168" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 168</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 211</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longis considere scamnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:305" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 305</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedere in scamnis equitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:41:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 41, 7</bibl></cit>.— Of <hi rend="ital">horizontal branches of trees serving as seats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 201</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a throne</hi>: regni stabilita scamna solumque, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (Ann. v. 99 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n42854.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n42854.3" n="A" level="2"> In agriculture, <hi rend="ital">a bank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ridge of earth</hi> left in ploughing, <hi rend="ital">a balk</hi> (cf.: lira, <pb n="1639" /> <cb n="SCAN" /> porca), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:3" default="NO">2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:10" default="NO">3, 13, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 12:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 179</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42854.4" n="B" level="2"> In the agrimensores, <hi rend="ital">the breadth of a field</hi> (opp. striga, the length), Auct. Rei Agr. p. 46; 125; 198 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
scandalizo: <entryFree id="n42855" type="greek" key="scanda^lizo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scandălizo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">skandalizw,</foreign> <sense id="n42855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause to stumble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempt to evil</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cor. Mil. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 15, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,047:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Mal. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 5, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scandalum: <entryFree id="n42856" type="greek" key="scanda^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scandălum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ska/ndalon</foreign>, <sense id="n42856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which causes one to stumble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stumblingblock</hi> (eccl. Lat.). * </sense><sense id="n42856.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 47 praef.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42856.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an inducement to sin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a temptation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause of offence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Jud. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:118:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 118, 165</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl> Johan. 2, 10.</sense></entryFree>
scandia: <entryFree id="n42857" type="main" key="Scandi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scandĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Scandinavia.</entryFree>
scandianus: <entryFree id="n42858" type="main" key="Scandi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scandĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n42858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">named from one Scandius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scandila: <entryFree id="n42859" type="main" key="Scandila"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scandila</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near Eubœa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Skantzoura</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 72</bibl> (al. Scandira); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scandinavia: <entryFree id="n42860" type="main" key="Scandi^na_vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scandĭnāvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large and fruitful island in Northern Europe;</hi> acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">Zealand;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">Schonen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 15, 16, § 39</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scandĭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scandix: <entryFree id="n42861" type="greek" key="scandix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scandix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ska/ndic,</foreign> <sense id="n42861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the herb chervil</hi>: Scandix caerefolium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 52, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:81" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 38, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scando: <entryFree id="n42862" type="main" key="scando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scando</orth> (no <sense id="n42862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sup.;</hi> cf.: ascendo, descendo, etc.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root skand-, to climb; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ska/ndalon, skanda/lhqron</foreign></etym>. </sense><sense id="n42862.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to climb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clamber</hi> or <hi rend="ital">get up; to ascend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42862.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): cum alii malos scandant, alii per foros cursent, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem et Capitolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in curru Capitolium (of a triumphal entry),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curru Capitolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum scalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 2</bibl></cit>, §9: <cit><quote lang="la">equum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia longa Theseae viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 24: <cit><quote lang="la">cubile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 90: <cit><quote lang="la">puppim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbam (Charontis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit> (4, 17), 24 et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">In mal. part.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">scandit fatalis machina muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 237</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42862.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (only in the poets and in late prose): <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim gradus aetatis scandere adultae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scandit aeratas vitiosa naves Cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 21</bibl></cit>.— Hence, in the grammarians: scandere versus, qs. to climb up, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">read</hi> by its feet, <hi rend="ital">to scan;</hi> cf. in a sarcastic double sense, of a gouty person: <cit><quote lang="la">scandere qui nescis, versiculos laceras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 29, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42862.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascend</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n42862.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum scandit et instat,</quote> <trans><tr>climbs the wall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 651</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scandenti circa ima labor est: ceterum quantum processeris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scandere in aggerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domos superas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:298" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nidum volucris (feles),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per conjuncta aedificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super iteratam testudinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42862.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">scandentisque Asisi consurgit vertice murus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 125: <cit><quote lang="la">in tecta jam silvae scandunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 14, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae in sublime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol ad aquilonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 28, 68, § 264</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42862.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor et minae Scandunt eodem, quo dominus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra principem scandere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scandula: <entryFree id="n42863" type="main" key="scandu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scandŭla</orth> (later form <orth extent="full" lang="la">scindŭla</orth>, as if from scindo), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scando</etym>, <sense id="n42863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shingle</hi> for a roof (so named from their rising, like steps, one above the other); mostly <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:42" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 42 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 15, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 10, 18, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 19, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scandulaca: <entryFree id="n42864" type="gloss" key="scandulaca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scandulaca</orth> <itype>genus herbae frugibus inimicae, quod eas velut hedera implicando necat</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=330" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 330</bibl>.</entryFree>
scandularis: <entryFree id="n42865" type="hapax" key="scandu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scandŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scandula</etym>, <sense id="n42865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shingled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shingle-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 137, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scandularius: <entryFree id="n42866" type="hapax" key="scandu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scandŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shingler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:6:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scansilis: <entryFree id="n42867" type="main" key="scansi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scansĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scando</etym>, <sense id="n42867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be climbed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42867.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 84</bibl></cit>: gradus superiores scansiles, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:45" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 10, 14</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n42867.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: lex annorum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the law of critical years</hi> <cb n="SCAP" /> (placed at certain distances or steps from each other) or <hi rend="ital">climacterics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scansio: <entryFree id="n42868" type="main" key="scansi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scansĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scando</etym>, <sense id="n42868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a climbing up</hi> (very rare). * </sense><sense id="n42868.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā simplici scansione scandebant in lectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=168" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 168</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n42868.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: sonorum, <hi rend="ital">a rising</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elevation of tones</hi> of the voice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1</bibl>. —In gram., <hi rend="ital">a metrical reading</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scanning</hi> of verse, <hi rend="ital">scansion</hi>, Beda, p. 2368 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 494 sq.</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
scansorius: <entryFree id="n42869" type="hapax" key="scanso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scansōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for climbing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus machinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scantia: <entryFree id="n42870" type="main" key="Scanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scantĭa silva</orth>, v. Scantius, A.</entryFree>
scantianus: <entryFree id="n42871" type="main" key="Scanti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scantĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Scantius, B.</entryFree>
scantinius: <entryFree id="n42872" type="main" key="Scanti_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scantīnĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Scātīnĭus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42872.1" n="a" level="4"> P. Scantinius, <hi rend="ital">a pontifex</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—<orth extent="full" lang="la">b</orth>. C. Scantinius Capitolinus, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scantīnĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Scātīn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the</hi> Lex Scantinia (Scātīnĭa) de nefandă Venere <hi rend="ital">is named after one Scantinius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, otherwise unknown, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:44" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 12</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 203.—Form Scatinia, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 89, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scantius: <entryFree id="n42873" type="main" key="Scanti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scantĭus</orth>, <sense id="n42873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi>, <hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, Scantia, <hi rend="ital">a woman abused by Clodius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 75</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42873.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scantĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Scantian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <trans><tr>in Campania</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae, perh. in the same place,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 107, 111, § 240</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42873.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scantĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Scantian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 143</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 50</bibl> (Jahn, Scandianus): vitis, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scapha: <entryFree id="n42874" type="greek" key="sca^pha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăpha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym> = <foreign lang="greek">ska/fh</foreign>; cf. scabo</etym>, <sense id="n42874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a light boat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a skiff</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lembus, cymba): de navi timidae desiluerunt in scapham,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 76</bibl>; 1, 2, 84; 2, 3, 36; 2, 3, 38; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 19</bibl>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 535, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 42</bibl>: biremis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 13, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scaphe: <entryFree id="n42875" type="greek" key="sca^phe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăphē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ska/fh,</foreign> <sense id="n42875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a concave sundial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scaphium: <entryFree id="n42876" type="greek" key="sca^phi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăphĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scăpĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ska/fion.</foreign> <sense id="n42876.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a concave vessel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">basin in the form of a boat</hi> (cf. cymbium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1046" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1046</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42876.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n42876.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A drinking-vessel in the form of a boat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 24, § 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42876.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A chamber-pot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:11:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:264" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42876.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A concave sundial</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 597</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42876.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The reservoir of a water -clock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scaphula: <entryFree id="n42877" type="main" key="sca^phu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăphŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scapha</etym>, <sense id="n42877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little boat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">skiff</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 49, 1</bibl>.—Used as <hi rend="ital">a bath-tub</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:40:232" default="NO">2, 40, 232</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scaptesula: <entryFree id="n42878" type="main" key="Scapte_su^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scaptēsŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Scaptensŭla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*skapthsu/lh,</foreign> <sense id="n42878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its silver mines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 810</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=330" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 330</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
scaptia: <entryFree id="n42879" type="main" key="Scapti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scaptĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town in Latium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Passerano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scaptĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Scaptia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Scaptian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scaptĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Scaptian tribe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scapula: <entryFree id="n42880" type="main" key="Sca^pu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scăpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42880.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A partisan of Pompey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the main instigator of the Spanish war</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42880.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A usurer in the time of Cicero</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 17</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scă-pŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">named after one Scapula</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 40, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42881" type="main" key="sca^pu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vine</hi>, = vennucula, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 6, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42882" type="main" key="sca^pu^la3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. scapulae <sense id="n42882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scapulae: <entryFree id="n42883" type="main" key="sca^pu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăpŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the shoulder-blades</hi>, in men and animals. </sense><sense id="n42883.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 89, § 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:125" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 14, 43, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 273</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:107 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 107 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42883.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42883.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The shoulders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">back</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui saepe ante in nostras scapulas cicatrices indiderunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have cut me over the shoulders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:12:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 12, 5</bibl>: pro scapulis cum dicit Cato, significat pro injuriă verberum. Nam complures leges erant in cives rogatae, quibus <cb n="SCAT" /> sanciebatur poena verberum, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=234" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 234</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n42883.4" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">machinae,</quote> <trans><tr>shoulder-pieces</tr>, <tr>cheeks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium,</quote> <trans><tr>the higher ridges</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42883.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scăpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the shoulder</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">panem imposuit scapulae ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 21, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Zach. 7, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scapulani: <entryFree id="n42884" type="main" key="sca^pu^la_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăpŭlāni horti</orth>, v. Scapula.</entryFree>
scapus: <entryFree id="n42885" type="greek" key="scapus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scapus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root skap-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skh/ptw,</foreign> to prop, <foreign lang="greek">skh=ptron</foreign>; Doric, <foreign lang="greek">ska=pos;</foreign> cf.: scipio, scamnum, scopus; Engl. shaft</etym>, <sense id="n42885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stalk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trunk</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n42885.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 21, § 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42885.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n42885.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cylinder on which sheets of paper</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leaves of papyrus were rolled</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 77</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42885.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sheet of paper</hi>: aliquid papyri illinere scapo, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 168, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42885.5" n="C" level="2"> A weaver's <hi rend="ital">yarn-beam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1353</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42885.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The shaft</hi> of a column, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42885.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The shank</hi> of a candlestick, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 6, § 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42885.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The post</hi> or <hi rend="ital">newel</hi> of a circular staircase, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42885.9" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The main stile</hi> of a door on which it hinged, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42885.10" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The beam</hi> of a balance, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl>; Fest. s. v. agina, p. 10 Müll.; and s. v. librile, p. 116 ib.—</sense><sense id="n42885.11" n="K" level="1"> = membrum virile, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 14, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scarabaeus: <entryFree id="n42886" type="greek" key="sca^ra^baeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scărăbaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skara/beios</foreign> <foreign lang="greek">ska/rabos</foreign>), <sense id="n42886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beetle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarabee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:99" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 11, 30, § 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 70, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scardia: <entryFree id="n42887" type="main" key="scardi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scardĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> aristolochia, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scardus: <entryFree id="n42888" type="main" key="Scardus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scardus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Scordus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Illyria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sharradagh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Tchardagh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scarifatio: <entryFree id="n42889" type="main" key="sca^ri_fa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scărīfātĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">scărīphātĭo</orth>; later collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">scărīfĭcātĭo</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 21, 1</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scarifo</etym>, <sense id="n42889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scratching open;</hi> of the skin, <hi rend="ital">a scarifying</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:1" default="NO">6, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:4" default="NO">6, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 21, 1</bibl>.—Of the bark of a tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 42, § 251</bibl>.—Of the ground for planting, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 39, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scarifico: <entryFree id="n42890" type="greek" key="sca^ri_fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scărīfĭco</orth>, v. scarifo-.</entryFree>
scarifo: <entryFree id="n42891" type="main" key="sca^ri_fo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scărīfo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-īpho</orth>; later collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">scă-rīfĭco</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10, 28</bibl>; cf. <sense id="n42891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> scarifio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:262" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 262</bibl> dub.), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ska^ri=fa/omai,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">to scratch open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarify</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gingivas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 26, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncum arboris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinapi compressum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:57:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 57, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 179</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 3, 8, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scaritis: <entryFree id="n42892" type="greek" key="sca^ri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scărītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skari=tis,</foreign> <sense id="n42892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resembling in color the fish</hi> scarus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scarphea: <entryFree id="n42893" type="main" key="Scarphe_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scarphēa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ĭ_a</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n42893.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Locris</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Thermopylœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:20" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42893.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island of the Ægean Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scarus: <entryFree id="n42894" type="greek" key="sca^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scărus</orth> (scārus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ska/ros,</foreign> <sense id="n42894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of seafish much esteemed by the Romans;</hi> acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">a species of wrasse</hi>: Labrus scarus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 29, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 1</bibl> and 9; Enn. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:84" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 84</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Fest. s. v. pollucere, p. 253: scarorum jocinora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scatebra: <entryFree id="n42895" type="main" key="sca^te^_bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scătĕ_bra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scateo</etym>, <sense id="n42895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bubbling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gushing up</hi> of water (not ante-Aug., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fontium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fonticuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42895.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(unda) scatebris arentia temperat arva,</quote> <trans><tr>spring - water</tr>, <tr>bubbling water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 110</bibl></cit>; cf. scaturex and scaturigines.</sense></entryFree>
scateo: <entryFree id="n42896" type="main" key="sca^teo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăteo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype> (ante-class. also scatit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:891" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 891</bibl>; and scatĕre, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl>, or Trag. v. 196 Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 598</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:952" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 952</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:896" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 896</bibl>; <sense id="n42896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> wanting), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Lith. skas-, leap</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bubble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">flow forth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not before the Aug. period in prose). </sense><sense id="n42896.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: fontes scatere, Enn. l. l.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fons dulcis aquaï qui scatit et salsas circum se dimovet undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:891 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 891 sq.</bibl></cit>; and (with erumpere) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:952" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 952</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:598" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 598</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42896.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, = abundo. </sense><sense id="n42896.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be plentiful; to swarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuniculi scatent in Hispaniă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 58, 83, § 226</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:896" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 896</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42896.4" n="B" level="2"> With <case>abl.</case> (once also with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> and with an <hi rend="ital">acc. of respect</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to gush forth with</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to be full of; to swarm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abound with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be rich in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowded with</hi> any thing, etc. </sense><sense id="n42896.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<hi rend="ital">a</hi>) With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino scatet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx (Corinthi) scatens fontibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scatentem Beluis pontum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus scatet piscibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tota ferme Hispania metallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1640" /> <cb n="SCEL" /> § <cit><quote lang="la">30: Terracina silvis nucum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 32, 59, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scatere vermibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 16, 20</bibl></cit>: gentes tigri ferā. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 73</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42896.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra ferarum scatit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 891</bibl> supra.—</sense><sense id="n42896.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualibus ostentis Aristandri volumen sca-tet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 25, 38, § 243</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic videas quosdam scatere verbis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:4" default="NO">17, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(urtica) vel plurimis scatet remediis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 13, 15, § 31</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. respect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amas pol, misera: id tuos scatet animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scatinius: <entryFree id="n42897" type="main" key="Sca_ti_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scātīnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. Scantinius.</entryFree>
scato: <entryFree id="n42898" type="main" key="sca^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scăto</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v scateo <sense id="n42898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scaturex: <entryFree id="n42899" type="hapax" key="sca^tu_rex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scătūrex</orth>, <itype>igis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scaturio</etym>, <sense id="n42899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bubbling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gushing spring</hi>, Varr, ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 27</bibl>; cf. scaturigines and scatebra.</sense></entryFree>
scaturigines: <entryFree id="n42900" type="main" key="sca^tu_ri_gi^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scătūrīgĭnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gushing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bubbling waters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spring-water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 10" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nigrā (terrā) scaturigines perennes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 28, § 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42900.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other fluids: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scaturiginosus: <entryFree id="n42901" type="hapax" key="sca^tu_ri_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scătūrīgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scaturigines</etym>, <sense id="n42901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abounding in springs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">springy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>boggy</tr>, <tr>marshy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:8:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scaturio: <entryFree id="n42902" type="main" key="sca^tu_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scătūrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype> (<sense id="n42902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> scaturribat, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 145, 8</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>scateo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to stream</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flow</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">gush out</hi> (not before the Aug. period, and very rare). </sense><sense id="n42902.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">scaturiens aqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de summo vertice fons scaturribat (i. e. -riebat),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, 6, p. 145, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum de terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1206,001:Lib. Mem. 8:section=5" default="NO"><author>Ampel.</author> Lib. Mem. 8, § 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42902.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like scateo. </sense><sense id="n42902.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To come forth in great numbers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vermiculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vermes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42902.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be full of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filled with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abound in</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n42902.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum, quod fontibus non scaturiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42902.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: (Curio) totus, ut nunc est, hoc scaturit, <hi rend="ital">he is all possessed with it</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 2</bibl>: aurae scaturientes sermonis, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 551.</sense></entryFree>
scaurianus: <entryFree id="n42903" type="main" key="Scauri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scaurĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Scaurus.<sense id="n42903.0" n="1" level="3"> † <orth extent="full" lang="la">scaurus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">skau=ros</foreign> [cf. <foreign lang="greek">skaio/s</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">with large and swollen ankles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having the ankles bunching out</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">varus, valgus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 105, § 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum Balbutit scaurum pravis fultum male talis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scaurus: <entryFree id="n42904" type="main" key="Scaurus" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scaurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. scaurus</etym>, <sense id="n42904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frequent surname in the</hi> gens Aemilia <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Aurelia. So, M. Aemilius Scaurus, <hi rend="ital">whom Cicero defended in an oration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part of which is still extant.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scaurĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">relating to Scaurus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 441</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scazon: <entryFree id="n42905" type="greek" key="sca_zon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scāzon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ska/zwn</foreign> (limping), <sense id="n42905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an iambic trimeter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a spondee or trochee in the last foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 11, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:97:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 97, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:25:1" default="NO">7, 25, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scelerate: <entryFree id="n42906" type="main" key="sce^le^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlĕrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. scelero, <sense id="n42906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scelerator: <entryFree id="n42907" type="main" key="sce^le^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlĕrātor</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scelero</etym>, <sense id="n42907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an evil doer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wretch</hi> (late Lat.), Adaman. Columb. 3, 7.</sense></entryFree>
sceleratus: <entryFree id="n42908" type="main" key="sce^le^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of scelero.</entryFree>
sceleritas: <entryFree id="n42909" type="main" key="sce^le^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scelus</etym>, <sense id="n42909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">guilt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wickedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">criminality</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:21:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scelero: <entryFree id="n42910" type="main" key="sce^le^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n42910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to pollute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contaminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desecrate</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> rare, and only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: temero, polluo): impia non verita est divos scelerare parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 405</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:663" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 663</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine fauces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 761</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce pias scelerare manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cererem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:122" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 122</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dextram sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:666" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 666</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">polluted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profaned</hi> by crime. </sense><sense id="n42910.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (appellatively; <cit><quote lang="la">only in the poets): terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:6:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limina Thracum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 628</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42910.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., as an <hi rend="ital">adj. prop.</hi>, denoting places where crimes had been committed or criminals punished. So, </sense><sense id="n42910.3" n="a" level="4"> Sceleratus Vicus, <hi rend="ital">that part of the Vicus Cyprius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Esquiline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which Tullia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Servius Tullius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drove over her father</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s corpse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=159" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 159</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:609" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 609</bibl>; Fest. pp. 332 and 333 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n42910.4" n="b" level="4"> Sceleratus Campus, <hi rend="ital">under the city will hard by the porta Collina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where unchaste Vestals were buried alive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 15</bibl>; Fest. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 11, 206</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42910.5" n="c" level="4"> Scelerata sedes, <hi rend="ital">the place of punishment for the wicked in Tartarus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:67" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 67</bibl>; Ov. <cb n="SCEL" /> M. 4, 455; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Sceleratum limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 563</bibl></cit>.—For Scelerata Porta and Castra, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, B. 2. b.—</sense><sense id="n42910.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42910.7" n="1" level="3"> Subjectively, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wicked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ac-cursed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flagitious;</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">masc. subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impious</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">vicious person ; a wretch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">miscreant</hi> (the predom. signif.; freq. with nefarius, impious, etc.; cf. consceleratus); <cit><quote lang="la">of persons: virum sceleratum, facinorosum, nefarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:17:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 17, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberantium genus totum sceleratum et impium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 8, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:30:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 30, 62</bibl> (with nefarius); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 15, 5</bibl> (with impurus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13</bibl> (with impius); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facto plus et sceleratus eodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 299</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 221 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo sceleratior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 781</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">refertam esse Graeciam sceleratissimorum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32</bibl> et saep.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleratas ejus preces et nefaria vota cognovimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 68, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra patriam scelerata arma capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insania belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox (with inhumana),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor habendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:439" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 439</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a sceleratiore hastā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa parricidii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 2, 1</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraus humani ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 39, § 138</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subit ira sceleratas sumere poenas,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to take satisfaction for her crimes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 576</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n42910.8" n="2" level="3"> (As a result of viciousness or criminality; cf. scelus, II. C.) <hi rend="ital">Hurtful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harmful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pernicious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unhappy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfortunate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calamitous</hi>, etc. (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">teritur sinapis scelerata: qui terunt, oculi ut exstillent, facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleratissimis serpentium haemorrhoidi et presteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 73, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:102:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 102, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:50:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 50, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.: MATER, Inscr. Rein. cl. 12, 122; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 237, 631</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">PARENTES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1187, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42910.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Made hurtful</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">poisoned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerata sucis spicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:272" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 272</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42910.10" n="c" level="4"> As an <hi rend="ital">adj. prop.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42910.11" n="(a)" level="5"> Scelerata Porta, <hi rend="ital">the gate</hi> (also called Porta Carmentalis) <hi rend="ital">through which the three hundred</hi> Fabii <hi rend="ital">marched on their fatal expedition</hi>, Fest. pp. 334 and 335 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 337</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42910.12" n="(b)" level="5"> Scelerata Castra, <hi rend="ital">the camp in which D. Drusus died</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlĕrātē</orth> (acc. to B. 1.), <hi rend="ital">impiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wickedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nefariously</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">peccavi scelerateque feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere (with audacter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere (opp. pie),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:38:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 38, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">susceptum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleratius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:16:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 16, 52</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleratissime machinatus omnes insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 64, 133</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
